     491             : 
     492           1 : NS_QUERYFRAME_HEAD(nsFrame)
     493           1 :   NS_QUERYFRAME_ENTRY(nsIFrame)
     494             : NS_QUERYFRAME_TAIL_INHERITANCE_ROOT
     495             : 
     496             : /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
     497             : // nsIFrame
     498             : 
     499             : static bool
     500           1 : IsFontSizeInflationContainer(nsIFrame* aFrame,
     501             :                              const nsStyleDisplay* aStyleDisplay)
     502             : {
     503             :   /*
     504             :    * Font size inflation is built around the idea that we're inflating
     505             :    * the fonts for a pan-and-zoom UI so that when the user scales up a
     506             :    * block or other container to fill the width of the device, the fonts
     507             :    * will be readable.  To do this, we need to pick what counts as a
     508             :    * container.
     509             :    *
     510             :    * From a code perspective, the only hard requirement is that frames
     511             :    * that are line participants
     512             :    * (nsIFrame::IsFrameOfType(nsIFrame::eLineParticipant)) are never
     513             :    * containers, since line layout assumes that the inflation is
     514             :    * consistent within a line.
     515             :    *
     516             :    * This is not an imposition, since we obviously want a bunch of text
     517             :    * (possibly with inline elements) flowing within a block to count the
     518             :    * block (or higher) as its container.
     519             :    *
     520             :    * We also want form controls, including the text in the anonymous
     521             :    * content inside of them, to match each other and the text next to
     522             :    * them, so they and their anonymous content should also not be a
     523             :    * container.
     524             :    *
     525             :    * However, because we can't reliably compute sizes across XUL during
     526             :    * reflow, any XUL frame with a XUL parent is always a container.
     527             :    *
     528             :    * There are contexts where it would be nice if some blocks didn't
     529             :    * count as a container, so that, for example, an indented quotation
     530             :    * didn't end up with a smaller font size.  However, it's hard to
     531             :    * distinguish these situations where we really do want the indented
     532             :    * thing to count as a container, so we don't try, and blocks are
     533             :    * always containers.
     534             :    */
     535             : 
     536             :   // The root frame should always be an inflation container.
     537           1 :   if (!aFrame->GetParent()) {
     538             :     return true;
     539             :   }
     540             : 
     541           0 :   nsIContent *content = aFrame->GetContent();
     542           0 :   nsIAtom* frameType = aFrame->GetType();
     543           0 :   bool isInline = (aFrame->GetDisplay() == StyleDisplay::Inline ||
     544           0 :                    RubyUtils::IsRubyBox(frameType) ||
     545           0 :                    (aFrame->IsFloating() &&
     546           0 :                     frameType == nsGkAtoms::letterFrame) ||
     547             :                    // Given multiple frames for the same node, only the
     548             :                    // outer one should be considered a container.
     549             :                    // (Important, e.g., for nsSelectsAreaFrame.)
     550           0 :                    (aFrame->GetParent()->GetContent() == content) ||
     551           0 :                    (content && (content->IsAnyOfHTMLElements(nsGkAtoms::option,
     552             :                                                              nsGkAtoms::optgroup,
     553           0 :                                                              nsGkAtoms::select) ||
     554           0 :                                 content->IsInNativeAnonymousSubtree()))) &&
     555           0 :                   !(aFrame->IsXULBoxFrame() && aFrame->GetParent()->IsXULBoxFrame());
     556             :   NS_ASSERTION(!aFrame->IsFrameOfType(nsIFrame::eLineParticipant) ||
     557             :                isInline ||
     558             :                // br frames and mathml frames report being line
     559             :                // participants even when their position or display is
     560             :                // set
     561             :                aFrame->GetType() == nsGkAtoms::brFrame ||
     562             :                aFrame->IsFrameOfType(nsIFrame::eMathML),
     563             :                "line participants must not be containers");
     564             :   NS_ASSERTION(aFrame->GetType() != nsGkAtoms::bulletFrame || isInline,
     565             :                "bullets should not be containers");
     566           0 :   return !isInline;
     567             : }

     947           1 :   imgIRequest *newBorderImage = StyleBorder()->GetBorderImageRequest();
     948             :   // FIXME (Bug 759996): The following is no longer true.
     949             :   // For border-images, we can't be as conservative (we need to set the
     950             :   // new loaders if there has been any change) since the CalcDifference
     951             :   // call depended on the result of GetComputedBorder() and that result
     952             :   // depends on whether the image has loaded, start the image load now
     953             :   // so that we'll get notified when it completes loading and can do a
     954             :   // restyle.  Otherwise, the image might finish loading from the
     955             :   // network before we start listening to its notifications, and then
     956             :   // we'll never know that it's finished loading.  Likewise, we want to
     957             :   // do this for freshly-created frames to prevent a similar race if the
     958             :   // image loads between reflow (which can depend on whether the image
     959             :   // is loaded) and paint.  We also don't really care about any callers
     960             :   // who try to paint borders with a different style context, because
     961             :   // they won't have the correct size for the border either.
     962           1 :   if (oldBorderImage != newBorderImage) {
     963             :     // stop and restart the image loading/notification
     964           1 :     if (oldBorderImage) {
     965           1 :       imageLoader->DisassociateRequestFromFrame(oldBorderImage, this);

     967           1 :     if (newBorderImage) {
     968           1 :       imageLoader->AssociateRequestToFrame(newBorderImage, this);
     969             :     }
     970             :   }

    1018             : 
    1019             : void
    1020           1 : nsIFrame::SyncFrameViewProperties(nsView* aView)
    1021             : {
    1022           1 :   if (!aView) {
    1023           1 :     aView = GetView();
    1024           1 :     if (!aView) {
    1025           1 :       return;
    1026             :     }
    1027             :   }
    1028             : 
    1029           1 :   nsViewManager* vm = aView->GetViewManager();
    1030             : 
    1031             :   // Make sure visibility is correct. This only affects nsSubDocumentFrame.
    1032           1 :   if (!SupportsVisibilityHidden()) {
    1033             :     // See if the view should be hidden or visible

    1417             : bool
    1418           1 : nsIFrame::ComputeBorderRadii(const nsStyleCorners& aBorderRadius,
    1419             :                              const nsSize& aFrameSize,
    1420             :                              const nsSize& aBorderArea,
    1421             :                              Sides aSkipSides,
    1422             :                              nscoord aRadii[8])
    1423             : {
    1424             :   // Percentages are relative to whichever side they're on.
    1425           1 :   NS_FOR_CSS_HALF_CORNERS(i) {
    1426           1 :     const nsStyleCoord c = aBorderRadius.Get(i);
    1427             :     nscoord axis =
    1428           1 :       HalfCornerIsX(i) ? aFrameSize.width : aFrameSize.height;
    1429             : 
    1430           1 :     if (c.IsCoordPercentCalcUnit()) {
    1431           1 :       aRadii[i] = nsRuleNode::ComputeCoordPercentCalc(c, axis);
    1432           1 :       if (aRadii[i] < 0) {
    1433             :         // clamp calc()
    1434           0 :         aRadii[i] = 0;
    1435             :       }
    1436             :     } else {
    1437             :       NS_NOTREACHED("ComputeBorderRadii: bad unit");
    1438           0 :       aRadii[i] = 0;
    1439             :     }
    1440             :   }
    1441             : 
    1442           1 :   if (aSkipSides.Top()) {
    1443           1 :     aRadii[eCornerTopLeftX] = 0;
    1444           1 :     aRadii[eCornerTopLeftY] = 0;
    1445           1 :     aRadii[eCornerTopRightX] = 0;
    1446           1 :     aRadii[eCornerTopRightY] = 0;
    1447             :   }
    1448             : 
    1449           1 :   if (aSkipSides.Right()) {
    1450           1 :     aRadii[eCornerTopRightX] = 0;
    1451           1 :     aRadii[eCornerTopRightY] = 0;
    1452           1 :     aRadii[eCornerBottomRightX] = 0;
    1453           1 :     aRadii[eCornerBottomRightY] = 0;
    1454             :   }
    1455             : 
    1456           1 :   if (aSkipSides.Bottom()) {
    1457           0 :     aRadii[eCornerBottomRightX] = 0;
    1458           0 :     aRadii[eCornerBottomRightY] = 0;
    1459           0 :     aRadii[eCornerBottomLeftX] = 0;
    1460           0 :     aRadii[eCornerBottomLeftY] = 0;
    1461             :   }
    1462             : 
    1463           1 :   if (aSkipSides.Left()) {
    1464           1 :     aRadii[eCornerBottomLeftX] = 0;
    1465           1 :     aRadii[eCornerBottomLeftY] = 0;
    1466           1 :     aRadii[eCornerTopLeftX] = 0;
    1467           1 :     aRadii[eCornerTopLeftY] = 0;
    1468             :   }
    1469             : 
    1470             :   // css3-background specifies this algorithm for reducing
    1471             :   // corner radii when they are too big.
    1472           1 :   bool haveRadius = false;
    1473           1 :   double ratio = 1.0f;
    1474           1 :   NS_FOR_CSS_SIDES(side) {
    1475           1 :     uint32_t hc1 = SideToHalfCorner(side, false, true);
    1476           1 :     uint32_t hc2 = SideToHalfCorner(side, true, true);
    1477             :     nscoord length =
    1478           1 :       SideIsVertical(side) ? aBorderArea.height : aBorderArea.width;
    1479           1 :     nscoord sum = aRadii[hc1] + aRadii[hc2];
    1480           1 :     if (sum)
    1481           1 :       haveRadius = true;
    1482             : 
    1483             :     // avoid floating point division in the normal case
    1484           1 :     if (length < sum)
    1485           1 :       ratio = std::min(ratio, double(length)/sum);
    1486             :   }
    1487           1 :   if (ratio < 1.0) {
    1488           1 :     NS_FOR_CSS_HALF_CORNERS(corner) {
    1489           1 :       aRadii[corner] *= ratio;
    1490             :     }
    1491             :   }
    1492             : 
    1493           1 :   return haveRadius;
    1494             : }
    1495             : 
    1496             : /* static */ void
    1497           1 : nsIFrame::InsetBorderRadii(nscoord aRadii[8], const nsMargin &aOffsets)
    1498             : {
    1499           1 :   NS_FOR_CSS_SIDES(side) {
    1500           1 :     nscoord offset = aOffsets.Side(side);
    1501           1 :     uint32_t hc1 = SideToHalfCorner(side, false, false);
    1502           1 :     uint32_t hc2 = SideToHalfCorner(side, true, false);
    1503           1 :     aRadii[hc1] = std::max(0, aRadii[hc1] - offset);
    1504           1 :     aRadii[hc2] = std::max(0, aRadii[hc2] - offset);
    1505             :   }
    1506           1 : }
    1507             : 
    1508             : /* static */ void
    1509           0 : nsIFrame::OutsetBorderRadii(nscoord aRadii[8], const nsMargin &aOffsets)
    1510             : {
    1511           0 :   auto AdjustOffset = [] (const uint32_t aRadius, const nscoord aOffset) {
    1512             :     // Implement the cubic formula to adjust offset when aOffset > 0 and
    1513             :     // aRadius / aOffset < 1.
    1514             :     // https://drafts.csswg.org/css-shapes/#valdef-shape-box-margin-box
    1515           0 :     if (aOffset > 0) {
    1516           0 :       const double ratio = aRadius / double(aOffset);
    1517           0 :       if (ratio < 1.0) {
    1518           0 :         return nscoord(aOffset * (1.0 + std::pow(ratio - 1, 3)));
    1519             :       }
    1520             :     }
    1521             :     return aOffset;
    1522             :   };
    1523             : 
    1524           0 :   NS_FOR_CSS_SIDES(side) {
    1525           0 :     const nscoord offset = aOffsets.Side(side);
    1526           0 :     const uint32_t hc1 = SideToHalfCorner(side, false, false);
    1527           0 :     const uint32_t hc2 = SideToHalfCorner(side, true, false);
    1528           0 :     if (aRadii[hc1] > 0) {
    1529           0 :       const nscoord offset1 = AdjustOffset(aRadii[hc1], offset);

    1716             : void
    1717           1 : nsIFrame::UpdateVisibilitySynchronously()
    1718             : {
    1719           1 :   nsIPresShell* presShell = PresContext()->PresShell();
    1720           1 :   if (!presShell) {
    1721           1 :     return;
    1722             :   }
    1723             : 
    1724           1 :   if (presShell->AssumeAllFramesVisible()) {
    1725           1 :     presShell->EnsureFrameInApproximatelyVisibleList(this);
    1726           1 :     return;
    1727             :   }
    1728             : 
    1729           1 :   bool visible = StyleVisibility()->IsVisible();
    1730           1 :   nsIFrame* f = GetParent();
    1731             :   nsRect rect = GetRectRelativeToSelf();
    1732           1 :   nsIFrame* rectFrame = this;
    1733           1 :   while (f && visible) {
    1734           1 :     nsIScrollableFrame* sf = do_QueryFrame(f);
    1735           1 :     if (sf) {
    1736             :       nsRect transformedRect =
    1737           1 :         nsLayoutUtils::TransformFrameRectToAncestor(rectFrame, rect, f);
    1738           1 :       if (!sf->IsRectNearlyVisible(transformedRect)) {
    1739           1 :         visible = false;
    1740           1 :         break;
    1741             :       }
    1742             : 
    1743             :       // In this code we're trying to synchronously update *approximate*
    1744             :       // visibility. (In the future we may update precise visibility here as
    1745             :       // well, which is why the method name does not contain 'approximate'.) The
    1746             :       // IsRectNearlyVisible() check above tells us that the rect we're checking
    1747             :       // is approximately visible within the scrollframe, but we still need to
    1748             :       // ensure that, even if it was scrolled into view, it'd be visible when we
    1749             :       // consider the rest of the document. To do that, we move transformedRect
    1750             :       // to be contained in the scrollport as best we can (it might not fit) to
    1751             :       // pretend that it was scrolled into view.
    1752           1 :       rect = transformedRect.MoveInsideAndClamp(sf->GetScrollPortRect());
    1753           1 :       rectFrame = f;
    1754             :     }
    1755           1 :     nsIFrame* parent = f->GetParent();
    1756           1 :     if (!parent) {
    1757           1 :       parent = nsLayoutUtils::GetCrossDocParentFrame(f);
    1758           1 :       if (parent && parent->PresContext()->IsChrome()) {
    1759             :         break;
    1760             :       }
    1761             :     }
    1762           1 :     f = parent;
    1763             :   }
    1764             : 
    1765           1 :   if (visible) {
    1766           1 :     presShell->EnsureFrameInApproximatelyVisibleList(this);
    1767             :   } else {
    1768           1 :     presShell->RemoveFrameFromApproximatelyVisibleList(this);
    1769             :   }
    1770             : }
    1771             : 
    1772             : void
    1773           1 : nsIFrame::EnableVisibilityTracking()
    1774             : {
    1775           1 :   if (GetStateBits() & NS_FRAME_VISIBILITY_IS_TRACKED) {
    1776           0 :     return;  // Nothing to do.
    1777             :   }
    1778             : 
    1779           1 :   FrameProperties props = Properties();
    1780             :   MOZ_ASSERT(!props.Has(VisibilityStateProperty()),
    1781             :              "Shouldn't have a VisibilityStateProperty value "
    1782             :              "if NS_FRAME_VISIBILITY_IS_TRACKED is not set");
    1783             : 
    1784             :   // Add the state bit so we know to track visibility for this frame, and
    1785             :   // initialize the frame property.
    1786             :   AddStateBits(NS_FRAME_VISIBILITY_IS_TRACKED);
    1787           1 :   props.Set(VisibilityStateProperty(), 0);
    1788             : 
    1789           1 :   nsIPresShell* presShell = PresContext()->PresShell();
    1790           1 :   if (!presShell) {
    1791             :     return;
    1792             :   }
    1793             : 
    1794             :   // Schedule a visibility update. This method will virtually always be called
    1795             :   // when layout has changed anyway, so it's very unlikely that any additional
    1796             :   // visibility updates will be triggered by this, but this way we guarantee
    1797             :   // that if this frame is currently visible we'll eventually find out.
    1798           1 :   presShell->ScheduleApproximateFrameVisibilityUpdateSoon();
    1799             : }

    1801             : void
    1802           1 : nsIFrame::DisableVisibilityTracking()

    1966             : 
    1967             : void
    1968           1 : nsFrame::DisplaySelectionOverlay(nsDisplayListBuilder*   aBuilder,
    1969             :                                  nsDisplayList*          aList,
    1970             :                                  uint16_t                aContentType)
    1971             : {
    1972           1 :   if (!IsSelected() || !IsVisibleForPainting(aBuilder))
    1973           1 :     return;
    1974             :     
    1975           1 :   nsPresContext* presContext = PresContext();
    1976           1 :   nsIPresShell *shell = presContext->PresShell();
    1977           1 :   if (!shell)
    1978             :     return;
    1979             : 
    1980           1 :   int16_t displaySelection = shell->GetSelectionFlags();
    1981           1 :   if (!(displaySelection & aContentType))
    1982             :     return;
    1983             : 
    1984           1 :   const nsFrameSelection* frameSelection = GetConstFrameSelection();
    1985           1 :   int16_t selectionValue = frameSelection->GetDisplaySelection();
    1986             : 
    1987           1 :   if (selectionValue <= nsISelectionController::SELECTION_HIDDEN)
    1988             :     return; // selection is hidden or off
    1989             : 
    1990           1 :   nsIContent *newContent = mContent->GetParent();
    1991             : 
    1992             :   //check to see if we are anonymous content
    1993           1 :   int32_t offset = 0;
    1994           1 :   if (newContent) {
    1995             :     // XXXbz there has GOT to be a better way of determining this!
    1996           1 :     offset = newContent->IndexOf(mContent);
    1997             :   }
    1998             : 
    1999             :   //look up to see what selection(s) are on this frame
    2000             :   UniquePtr<SelectionDetails> details
    2001           1 :     = frameSelection->LookUpSelection(newContent, offset, 1, false);
    2002           1 :   if (!details)
    2003           1 :     return;
    2004             : 
    2005             :   bool normal = false;
    2006           1 :   for (SelectionDetails* sd = details.get(); sd; sd = sd->mNext.get()) {
    2007           1 :     if (sd->mSelectionType == SelectionType::eNormal) {
    2008           1 :       normal = true;
    2009             :     }
    2010             :   }
    2011             : 
    2012           1 :   if (!normal && aContentType == nsISelectionDisplay::DISPLAY_IMAGES) {
    2013             :     // Don't overlay an image if it's not in the primary selection.
    2014             :     return;
    2015             :   }
    2016             : 
    2017             :   aList->AppendNewToTop(new (aBuilder)
    2018           1 :     nsDisplaySelectionOverlay(aBuilder, this, selectionValue));
    2019             : }

    2111           1 : inline static bool IsSVGContentWithCSSClip(const nsIFrame *aFrame)
    2112             : {
    2113             :   // The CSS spec says that the 'clip' property only applies to absolutely
    2114             :   // positioned elements, whereas the SVG spec says that it applies to SVG
    2115             :   // elements regardless of the value of the 'position' property. Here we obey
    2116             :   // the CSS spec for outer-<svg> (since that's what we generally do), but
    2117             :   // obey the SVG spec for other SVG elements to which 'clip' applies.
    2118           1 :   return (aFrame->GetStateBits() & NS_FRAME_SVG_LAYOUT) &&
    2119             :           aFrame->GetContent()->IsAnyOfSVGElements(nsGkAtoms::svg,
    2120           1 :                                                    nsGkAtoms::foreignObject);
    2121             : }

    2334             : void
    2335           1 : nsIFrame::BuildDisplayListForStackingContext(nsDisplayListBuilder* aBuilder,
    2336             :                                              const nsRect&         aDirtyRect,
    2337             :                                              nsDisplayList*        aList) {
    2338           1 :   if (GetStateBits() & NS_FRAME_TOO_DEEP_IN_FRAME_TREE)
    2339           1 :     return;
    2340             : 
    2341             :   // Replaced elements have their visibility handled here, because
    2342             :   // they're visually atomic
    2343           1 :   if (IsFrameOfType(eReplaced) && !IsVisibleForPainting(aBuilder))
    2344             :     return;
    2345             : 
    2346           1 :   const nsStyleDisplay* disp = StyleDisplay();
    2347           1 :   const nsStyleEffects* effects = StyleEffects();
    2348             :   // We can stop right away if this is a zero-opacity stacking context and
    2349             :   // we're painting, and we're not animating opacity. Don't do this
    2350             :   // if we're going to compute plugin geometry, since opacity-0 plugins
    2351             :   // need to have display items built for them.
    2352             :   bool needEventRegions =
    2353           1 :     aBuilder->IsBuildingLayerEventRegions() &&
    2354           0 :     StyleUserInterface()->GetEffectivePointerEvents(this) !=
    2355           1 :       NS_STYLE_POINTER_EVENTS_NONE;
    2356           1 :   bool opacityItemForEventsAndPluginsOnly = false;
    2357           1 :   if (effects->mOpacity == 0.0 && aBuilder->IsForPainting() &&
    2358           1 :       !(disp->mWillChangeBitField & NS_STYLE_WILL_CHANGE_OPACITY) &&
    2359           1 :       !nsLayoutUtils::HasAnimationOfProperty(this, eCSSProperty_opacity)) {
    2360           1 :     if (needEventRegions ||
    2361           1 :         aBuilder->WillComputePluginGeometry()) {
    2362             :       opacityItemForEventsAndPluginsOnly = true;
    2363             :     } else {
    2364             :       return;
    2365             :     }
    2366             :   }
    2367             : 
    2368           1 :   if (disp->mWillChangeBitField != 0) {
    2369           1 :     aBuilder->AddToWillChangeBudget(this, GetSize());
    2370             :   }
    2371             : 
    2372           1 :   bool extend3DContext = Extend3DContext();

    2374           1 :   if (extend3DContext && !Combines3DTransformWithAncestors()) {
    2375             :     // Start a new preserves3d context to keep informations on
    2376             :     // nsDisplayListBuilder.
    2377           1 :     autoPreserves3DContext.emplace(aBuilder);
    2378             :     // Save dirty rect on the builder to avoid being distorted for
    2379             :     // multiple transforms along the chain.
    2380           1 :     aBuilder->SetPreserves3DDirtyRect(aDirtyRect);
    2381             :   }
    2382             : 
    2383             :   // For preserves3d, use the dirty rect already installed on the
    2384             :   // builder, since aDirtyRect maybe distorted for transforms along
    2385             :   // the chain.
    2386             :   nsRect dirtyRect = aDirtyRect;
    2387             : 
    2388           1 :   bool inTransform = aBuilder->IsInTransform();

    2390           1 :   bool hasPerspective = HasPerspective();

    2392             :   // a nsDisplayBlendContainer. Set the blend mode back when the routine exits
    2393             :   // so we keep track if the parent stacking context needs a container too.
    2394           1 :   AutoSaveRestoreContainsBlendMode autoRestoreBlendMode(*aBuilder);
    2395           1 :   aBuilder->SetContainsBlendMode(false);
    2396             :  
    2397             :   nsRect dirtyRectOutsideTransform = dirtyRect;
    2398           1 :   bool allowAsyncAnimation = false;
    2399           1 :   if (isTransformed) {
    2400           1 :     const nsRect overflow = GetVisualOverflowRectRelativeToSelf();
    2401             :     nsDisplayTransform::PrerenderDecision decision =
    2402           1 :         nsDisplayTransform::ShouldPrerenderTransformedContent(aBuilder, this, &dirtyRect);
    2403           1 :     switch (decision) {
    2404             :     case nsDisplayTransform::FullPrerender:
    2405           1 :       allowAsyncAnimation = true;
    2406           1 :       break;

    2408           0 :       allowAsyncAnimation = true;
    2409             :       MOZ_FALLTHROUGH;
    2410             :       // fall through to the NoPrerender case
    2411             :     case nsDisplayTransform::NoPrerender:
    2412           1 :       if (overflow.IsEmpty() && !extend3DContext) {
    2413           0 :         return;
    2414             :       }

    2416             :       // If we're in preserve-3d then grab the dirty rect that was given to the root
    2417             :       // and transform using the combined transform.

    2420             :       }

    2433             :   }
    2434           1 :   bool usingFilter = StyleEffects()->HasFilters();

    2436           1 :   bool usingSVGEffects = usingFilter || usingMask;
    2437             : 
    2438             :   nsRect dirtyRectOutsideSVGEffects = dirtyRect;

    2444             :   }
    2445             : 
    2446             :   // We build an opacity item if it's not going to be drawn by SVG content, or
    2447             :   // SVG effects. SVG effects won't handle the opacity if we want an active
    2448             :   // layer (for async animations), see

    2450             :   // nsSVGIntegrationsUtils::PaintFilter.
    2451           1 :   bool useOpacity = HasVisualOpacity() && !nsSVGUtils::CanOptimizeOpacity(this) &&
    2452           1 :                     (!usingSVGEffects || nsDisplayOpacity::NeedsActiveLayer(aBuilder, this));
    2453           1 :   bool useBlendMode = effects->mMixBlendMode != NS_STYLE_BLEND_NORMAL;
    2454           1 :   bool useStickyPosition = disp->mPosition == NS_STYLE_POSITION_STICKY &&
    2455             :     IsScrollFrameActive(aBuilder,
    2456           1 :                         nsLayoutUtils::GetNearestScrollableFrame(GetParent(),
    2457             :                         nsLayoutUtils::SCROLLABLE_SAME_DOC |
    2458           1 :                         nsLayoutUtils::SCROLLABLE_INCLUDE_HIDDEN));
    2459           1 :   bool useFixedPosition = disp->mPosition == NS_STYLE_POSITION_FIXED &&
    2460           1 :     (nsLayoutUtils::IsFixedPosFrameInDisplayPort(this) || BuilderHasScrolledClip(aBuilder));
    2461             : 
    2462             :   nsDisplayListBuilder::AutoBuildingDisplayList
    2463           1 :     buildingDisplayList(aBuilder, this, dirtyRect, true);
    2464             : 
    2465             :   // Depending on the effects that are applied to this frame, we can create
    2466             :   // multiple container display items and wrap them around our contents.
    2467             :   // This enum lists all the potential container display items, in the order
    2468             :   // outside to inside.
    2469             :   enum class ContainerItemType : uint8_t {
    2470             :     eNone = 0,
    2471             :     eOwnLayerIfNeeded,
    2472             :     eBlendMode,
    2473             :     eFixedPosition,
    2474             :     eOwnLayerForTransformWithRoundedClip,
    2475             :     ePerspective,
    2476             :     eTransform,
    2477             :     eSeparatorTransforms,
    2478             :     eOpacity,
    2479             :     eFilter,
    2480             :     eBlendContainer
    2481             :   };
    2482             : 
    2483           1 :   nsDisplayListBuilder::AutoContainerASRTracker contASRTracker(aBuilder);
    2484             : 
    2485           1 :   DisplayListClipState::AutoSaveRestore clipState(aBuilder);
    2486             : 
    2487             :   // If there is a current clip, then depending on the container items we
    2488             :   // create, different things can happen to it. Some container items simply
    2489             :   // propagate the clip to their children and aren't clipped themselves.
    2490             :   // But other container items, especially those that establish a different
    2491             :   // geometry for their contents (e.g. transforms), capture the clip on
    2492             :   // themselves and unset the clip for their contents. If we create more than
    2493             :   // one of those container items, the clip will be captured on the outermost
    2494             :   // one and the inner container items will be unclipped.
    2495           1 :   ContainerItemType clipCapturedBy = ContainerItemType::eNone;
    2496           1 :   if (useFixedPosition) {
    2497             :     clipCapturedBy = ContainerItemType::eFixedPosition;
    2498           1 :   } else if (isTransformed) {
    2499             :     const DisplayItemClipChain* currentClip =
    2500           1 :       aBuilder->ClipState().GetCurrentCombinedClipChain(aBuilder);
    2501           1 :     if ((hasPerspective || extend3DContext) &&
    2502           1 :         (currentClip && currentClip->HasRoundedCorners())) {
    2503             :       // If we're creating an nsDisplayTransform item that is going to combine
    2504             :       // its transform with its children (preserve-3d or perspective), then we
    2505             :       // can't have an intermediate surface. Mask layers force an intermediate
    2506             :       // surface, so if we're going to need both then create a separate
    2507             :       // wrapping layer for the mask.
    2508             :       clipCapturedBy = ContainerItemType::eOwnLayerForTransformWithRoundedClip;
    2509           1 :     } else if (hasPerspective) {
    2510             :       clipCapturedBy = ContainerItemType::ePerspective;
    2511             :     } else {
    2512           1 :       clipCapturedBy = ContainerItemType::eTransform;
    2513             :     }
    2514           1 :   } else if (usingFilter) {
    2515           1 :     clipCapturedBy = ContainerItemType::eFilter;
    2516             :   }
    2517             : 
    2518           1 :   if (clipCapturedBy != ContainerItemType::eNone) {
    2519           1 :     clipState.Clear();
    2520             :   }
    2521             : 
    2522           1 :   nsDisplayListCollection set;
    2523             :   {
    2524           1 :     DisplayListClipState::AutoSaveRestore nestedClipState(aBuilder);

    2578             :   }
    2579             : 
    2580             :   // Sort PositionedDescendants() in CSS 'z-order' order.  The list is already
    2581             :   // in content document order and SortByZOrder is a stable sort which
    2582             :   // guarantees that boxes produced by the same element are placed together
    2583             :   // in the sort. Consider a position:relative inline element that breaks
    2584             :   // across lines and has absolutely positioned children; all the abs-pos
    2585             :   // children should be z-ordered after all the boxes for the position:relative
    2586             :   // element itself.
    2587           1 :   set.PositionedDescendants()->SortByZOrder();
    2588             : 
    2589             :   nsDisplayList resultList;
    2590             :   // Now follow the rules of http://www.w3.org/TR/CSS21/zindex.html
    2591             :   // 1,2: backgrounds and borders
    2592           1 :   resultList.AppendToTop(set.BorderBackground());
    2593             :   // 3: negative z-index children.
    2594             :   for (;;) {
    2595           1 :     nsDisplayItem* item = set.PositionedDescendants()->GetBottom();
    2596           1 :     if (item && item->ZIndex() < 0) {
    2597           1 :       set.PositionedDescendants()->RemoveBottom();
    2598           1 :       resultList.AppendToTop(item);
    2599             :       continue;
    2600             :     }
    2601             :     break;
    2602           1 :   }
    2603             :   // 4: block backgrounds
    2604           1 :   resultList.AppendToTop(set.BlockBorderBackgrounds());
    2605             :   // 5: floats
    2606           1 :   resultList.AppendToTop(set.Floats());
    2607             :   // 7: general content
    2608           1 :   resultList.AppendToTop(set.Content());
    2609             :   // 7.5: outlines, in content tree order. We need to sort by content order
    2610             :   // because an element with outline that breaks and has children with outline
    2611             :   // might have placed child outline items between its own outline items.
    2612             :   // The element's outline items need to all come before any child outline
    2613             :   // items.
    2614           1 :   nsIContent* content = GetContent();
    2615           1 :   if (!content) {
    2616           1 :     content = PresContext()->Document()->GetRootElement();
    2617             :   }
    2618           1 :   if (content) {
    2619           1 :     set.Outlines()->SortByContentOrder(content);

    2839             : 
    2840             : static nsDisplayItem*
    2841           1 : WrapInWrapList(nsDisplayListBuilder* aBuilder,
    2842             :                nsIFrame* aFrame, nsDisplayList* aList,
    2843             :                const ActiveScrolledRoot* aContainerASR)
    2844             : {
    2845           1 :   nsDisplayItem* item = aList->GetBottom();
    2846           1 :   if (!item) {
    2847             :     return nullptr;
    2848             :   }
    2849             : 
    2850             :   // For perspective items we want to treat the 'frame' as being the transform
    2851             :   // frame that created it. This stops the transform frame from wrapping another
    2852             :   // nsDisplayWrapList around it (with mismatching reference frames), but still
    2853             :   // makes the perspective frame create one (so we have an atomic entry for z-index
    2854             :   // sorting).
    2855           1 :   nsIFrame *itemFrame = item->Frame();
    2856           1 :   if (item->GetType() == nsDisplayItem::TYPE_PERSPECTIVE) {
    2857           1 :     itemFrame = static_cast<nsDisplayPerspective*>(item)->TransformFrame();
    2858             :   }
    2859             : 
    2860           1 :   if (item->GetAbove() || itemFrame != aFrame) {
    2861           1 :     return new (aBuilder) nsDisplayWrapList(aBuilder, aFrame, aList, aContainerASR);
    2862             :   }
    2863           1 :   aList->RemoveBottom();
    2864           1 :   return item;
    2865             : }
    2866             : 
    2867             : void
    2868           1 : nsIFrame::BuildDisplayListForChild(nsDisplayListBuilder*   aBuilder,

    2955             :

    2958           0 :     dirty = child->GetVisualOverflowRect();
    2959           1 :   } else if (!(child->GetStateBits() & NS_FRAME_FORCE_DISPLAY_LIST_DESCEND_INTO)) {
    2960             :     // No need to descend into child to catch placeholders for visible
    2961             :     // positioned stuff. So see if we can short-circuit frame traversal here.
    2962             : 
    2963             :     // We can stop if child's frame subtree's intersection with the
    2964             :     // dirty area is empty.
    2965             :     // If the child is a scrollframe that we want to ignore, then we need
    2966             :     // to descend into it because its scrolled child may intersect the dirty
    2967             :     // area even if the scrollframe itself doesn't.

    3375             : 
    3376             : bool
    3377           1 : nsIFrame::IsSelectable(StyleUserSelect* aSelectStyle) const
    3378             : {
    3379             :   // it's ok if aSelectStyle is null
    3380             : 
    3381             :   // Like 'visibility', we must check all the parents: if a parent
    3382             :   // is not selectable, none of its children is selectable.
    3383             :   //
    3384             :   // The -moz-all value acts similarly: if a frame has 'user-select:-moz-all',
    3385             :   // all its children are selectable, even those with 'user-select:none'.
    3386             :   //
    3387             :   // As a result, if 'none' and '-moz-all' are not present in the frame hierarchy,
    3388             :   // aSelectStyle returns the first style that is not AUTO. If these values
    3389             :   // are present in the frame hierarchy, aSelectStyle returns the style of the
    3390             :   // topmost parent that has either 'none' or '-moz-all'.
    3391             :   //
    3392             :   // The -moz-text value acts as a way to override an ancestor's all/-moz-all value.
    3393             :   //
    3394             :   // For instance, if the frame hierarchy is:
    3395             :   //    AUTO     -> _MOZ_ALL  -> NONE -> TEXT,      the returned value is ALL
    3396             :   //    AUTO     -> _MOZ_ALL  -> NONE -> _MOZ_TEXT, the returned value is TEXT.
    3397             :   //    TEXT     -> NONE      -> AUTO -> _MOZ_ALL,  the returned value is TEXT
    3398             :   //    _MOZ_ALL -> TEXT      -> AUTO -> AUTO,      the returned value is ALL
    3399             :   //    _MOZ_ALL -> _MOZ_TEXT -> AUTO -> AUTO,      the returned value is TEXT.
    3400             :   //    AUTO     -> CELL      -> TEXT -> AUTO,      the returned value is TEXT
    3401             :   //
    3402           1 :   StyleUserSelect selectStyle  = StyleUserSelect::Auto;
    3403           1 :   nsIFrame* frame              = const_cast<nsIFrame*>(this);
    3404           1 :   bool containsEditable        = false;
    3405             : 
    3406           1 :   while (frame) {
    3407           1 :     const nsStyleUIReset* userinterface = frame->StyleUIReset();
    3408           1 :     switch (userinterface->mUserSelect) {
    3409             :       case StyleUserSelect::All:
    3410             :       case StyleUserSelect::MozAll:
    3411             :       {
    3412             :         // override the previous values
    3413           1 :         if (selectStyle != StyleUserSelect::MozText) {
    3414           1 :           selectStyle = userinterface->mUserSelect;
    3415             :         }
    3416           1 :         nsIContent* frameContent = frame->GetContent();
    3417           1 :         containsEditable = frameContent &&
    3418           1 :           frameContent->EditableDescendantCount() > 0;

    4126             : // The FrameTarget represents the closest frame to a point that can be selected
    4127             : // The frame is the frame represented, frameEdge says whether one end of the
    4128             : // frame is the result (in which case different handling is needed), and
    4129             : // afterFrame says which end is repersented if frameEdge is true
    4130             : struct FrameTarget {
    4131             :   FrameTarget(nsIFrame* aFrame, bool aFrameEdge, bool aAfterFrame,
    4132             :               bool aEmptyBlock = false) :
    4133             :     frame(aFrame), frameEdge(aFrameEdge), afterFrame(aAfterFrame),
    4134           1 :     emptyBlock(aEmptyBlock) { }
    4135           1 :   static FrameTarget Null() {
    4136           1 :     return FrameTarget(nullptr, false, false);
    4137             :   }
    4138             :   bool IsNull() {
    4139             :     return !frame;
    4140             :   }
    4141             :   nsIFrame* frame;
    4142             :   bool frameEdge;
    4143             :   bool afterFrame;
    4144             :   bool emptyBlock;
    4145             : };

    4147             : // See function implementation for information
    4148             : static FrameTarget GetSelectionClosestFrame(nsIFrame* aFrame, nsPoint aPoint,

    4150             : 
    4151           1 : static bool SelfIsSelectable(nsIFrame* aFrame, uint32_t aFlags)
    4152             : {
    4153           1 :   if ((aFlags & nsIFrame::SKIP_HIDDEN) &&
    4154           1 :       !aFrame->StyleVisibility()->IsVisible()) {
    4155             :     return false;
    4156             :   }
    4157           1 :   return !aFrame->IsGeneratedContentFrame() &&
    4158           1 :     aFrame->StyleUIReset()->mUserSelect != StyleUserSelect::None;
    4159             : }
    4160             : 
    4161           1 : static bool SelectionDescendToKids(nsIFrame* aFrame) {
    4162           1 :   StyleUserSelect style = aFrame->StyleUIReset()->mUserSelect;
    4163           1 :   nsIFrame* parent = aFrame->GetParent();
    4164             :   // If we are only near (not directly over) then don't traverse
    4165             :   // frames with independent selection (e.g. text and list controls)
    4166             :   // unless we're already inside such a frame (see bug 268497).  Note that this
    4167             :   // prevents any of the users of this method from entering form controls.
    4168             :   // XXX We might want some way to allow using the up-arrow to go into a form
    4169             :   // control, but the focus didn't work right anyway; it'd probably be enough
    4170             :   // if the left and right arrows could enter textboxes (which I don't believe
    4171             :   // they can at the moment)
    4172           1 :   return !aFrame->IsGeneratedContentFrame() &&
    4173           1 :          style != StyleUserSelect::All  &&
    4174           1 :          style != StyleUserSelect::None &&
    4175           1 :          ((parent->GetStateBits() & NS_FRAME_INDEPENDENT_SELECTION) ||
    4176           1 :           !(aFrame->GetStateBits() & NS_FRAME_INDEPENDENT_SELECTION));
    4177             : }
    4178             : 
    4179           1 : static FrameTarget GetSelectionClosestFrameForChild(nsIFrame* aChild,
    4180             :                                                     nsPoint aPoint,

    4182             : {

    4187             :   }

    4189             : }
    4190             : 
    4191             : // When the cursor needs to be at the beginning of a block, it shouldn't be
    4192             : // before the first child.  A click on a block whose first child is a block
    4193             : // should put the cursor in the child.  The cursor shouldn't be between the
    4194             : // blocks, because that's not where it's expected.
    4195             : // Note that this method is guaranteed to succeed.
    4196           1 : static FrameTarget DrillDownToSelectionFrame(nsIFrame* aFrame,
    4197             :                                              bool aEndFrame, uint32_t aFlags) {
    4198           1 :   if (SelectionDescendToKids(aFrame)) {

    4202           1 :       while (frame && (!SelfIsSelectable(frame, aFlags) ||
    4203           1 :                         frame->IsEmpty()))
    4204           1 :         frame = frame->GetNextSibling();
    4205           1 :       if (frame)
    4206           1 :         result = frame;
    4207             :     } else {
    4208             :       // Because the frame tree is singly linked, to find the last frame,
    4209             :       // we have to iterate through all the frames
    4210             :       // XXX I have a feeling this could be slow for long blocks, although
    4211             :       //     I can't find any slowdowns

    4213           1 :         if (!frame->IsEmpty() && SelfIsSelectable(frame, aFlags))
    4214           1 :           result = frame;
    4215           1 :         frame = frame->GetNextSibling();
    4216             :       }
    4217             :     }
    4218           1 :     if (result)
    4219           1 :       return DrillDownToSelectionFrame(result, aEndFrame, aFlags);
    4220             :   }
    4221             :   // If the current frame has no targetable children, target the current frame
    4222           1 :   return FrameTarget(aFrame, true, aEndFrame);

    4225             : // This method finds the closest valid FrameTarget on a given line; if there is
    4226             : // no valid FrameTarget on the line, it returns a null FrameTarget

    4281             : 
    4282             : // This method is for the special handling we do for block frames; they're
    4283             : // special because they represent paragraphs and because they are organized
    4284             : // into lines, which have bounds that are not stored elsewhere in the
    4285             : // frame tree.  Returns a null FrameTarget for frames which are not
    4286             : // blocks or blocks with no lines except editable one.
    4287           1 : static FrameTarget GetSelectionClosestFrameForBlock(nsIFrame* aFrame,
    4288             :                                                     nsPoint aPoint,
    4289             :                                                     uint32_t aFlags)
    4290             : {
    4291           1 :   nsBlockFrame* bf = nsLayoutUtils::GetAsBlock(aFrame); // used only for QI
    4292           1 :   if (!bf)
    4293           1 :     return FrameTarget::Null();
    4294             : 
    4295             :   // This code searches for the correct line
    4296           1 :   nsBlockFrame::LineIterator firstLine = bf->LinesBegin();

    4299           1 :     nsIContent *blockContent = aFrame->GetContent();
    4300           1 :     if (blockContent) {
    4301             :       // Return with empty flag true.
    4302           1 :       return FrameTarget(aFrame, false, false, true);
    4303             :     }
    4304           0 :     return FrameTarget::Null();
    4305             :   }
    4306           1 :   nsBlockFrame::LineIterator curLine = firstLine;
    4307           1 :   nsBlockFrame::LineIterator closestLine = end;
    4308             :   // Convert aPoint into a LogicalPoint in the writing-mode of this block
    4309           1 :   WritingMode wm = curLine->mWritingMode;
    4310           1 :   LogicalPoint pt(wm, aPoint, curLine->mContainerSize);

    4317             :       break; // We found the line; stop looking

    4326           1 :     nsBlockFrame::LineIterator nextLine = curLine;
    4327             :     // Avoid empty lines
    4328           1 :     while (nextLine != end && nextLine->IsEmpty())

    4342             :       closestLine = nextLine;
    4343           1 :     } else if (nextLine == end) {
    4344           1 :       if (dragOutOfFrame == 1)
    4345           1 :         return DrillDownToSelectionFrame(aFrame, true, aFlags);
    4346             :       closestLine = prevLine;
    4347             :     } else { // Figure out which line is closer
    4348           1 :       if (pt.B(wm) - prevLine->BEnd() < nextLine->BStart() - pt.B(wm))
    4349             :         closestLine = prevLine;
    4350             :       else
    4351             :         closestLine = nextLine;
    4352             :     }
    4353             :   }
    4354             : 
    4355           1 :   do {
    4356             :     FrameTarget target = GetSelectionClosestFrameForLine(bf, closestLine,
    4357           1 :                                                          aPoint, aFlags);
    4358           1 :     if (!target.IsNull())
    4359           1 :       return target;
    4360             :     ++closestLine;
    4361             :   } while (closestLine != end);
    4362             :   // Fall back to just targeting the last targetable place
    4363           1 :   return DrillDownToSelectionFrame(aFrame, true, aFlags);
    4364             : }
    4365             : 
    4366             : // GetSelectionClosestFrame is the helper function that calculates the closest
    4367             : // frame to the given point.
    4368             : // It doesn't completely account for offset styles, so needs to be used in
    4369             : // restricted environments.
    4370             : // Cannot handle overlapping frames correctly, so it should receive the output
    4371             : // of GetFrameForPoint
    4372             : // Guaranteed to return a valid FrameTarget
    4373           1 : static FrameTarget GetSelectionClosestFrame(nsIFrame* aFrame, nsPoint aPoint,
    4374             :                                             uint32_t aFlags)
    4375             : {
    4376             :   {
    4377             :     // Handle blocks; if the frame isn't a block, the method fails
    4378           1 :     FrameTarget target = GetSelectionClosestFrameForBlock(aFrame, aPoint, aFlags);
    4379           1 :     if (!target.IsNull())
    4380           1 :       return target;
    4381             :   }
    4382             : 
    4383           1 :   nsIFrame *kid = aFrame->PrincipalChildList().FirstChild();
    4384             : 
    4385           1 :   if (kid) {
    4386             :     // Go through all the child frames to find the closest one
    4387           1 :     nsIFrame::FrameWithDistance closest = { nullptr, nscoord_MAX, nscoord_MAX };
    4388           1 :     for (; kid; kid = kid->GetNextSibling()) {
    4389           1 :       if (!SelfIsSelectable(kid, aFlags) || kid->IsEmpty())
    4390             :         continue;
    4391             : 
    4392           1 :       kid->FindCloserFrameForSelection(aPoint, &closest);
    4393             :     }
    4394           1 :     if (closest.mFrame) {
    4395           1 :       if (nsSVGUtils::IsInSVGTextSubtree(closest.mFrame))

    4708             : void
    4709           1 : nsIFrame::InlinePrefISizeData::ForceBreak(StyleClear aBreakType)
    4710             : {
    4711             :   MOZ_ASSERT(aBreakType == StyleClear::None ||
    4712             :              aBreakType == StyleClear::Both ||
    4713             :              aBreakType == StyleClear::Left ||
    4714             :              aBreakType == StyleClear::Right,
    4715             :              "Must be a physical break type");
    4716             : 
    4717             :   // If this force break is not clearing any float, we can leave all the
    4718             :   // floats to the next force break.
    4719           1 :   if (mFloats.Length() != 0 && aBreakType != StyleClear::None) {
    4720             :             // preferred widths accumulated for floats that have already
    4721             :             // been cleared past
    4722           1 :     nscoord floats_done = 0,
    4723             :             // preferred widths accumulated for floats that have not yet
    4724             :             // been cleared past
    4725           1 :             floats_cur_left = 0,
    4726           1 :             floats_cur_right = 0;
    4727           1 :     const WritingMode wm = mLineContainerWM;
    4728             : 
    4729           1 :     for (uint32_t i = 0, i_end = mFloats.Length(); i != i_end; ++i) {
    4730           1 :       const FloatInfo& floatInfo = mFloats[i];
    4731           1 :       const nsStyleDisplay* floatDisp = floatInfo.Frame()->StyleDisplay();

    4733           1 :       if (breakType == StyleClear::Left ||
    4734           1 :           breakType == StyleClear::Right ||
    4735           1 :           breakType == StyleClear::Both) {
    4736             :         nscoord floats_cur = NSCoordSaturatingAdd(floats_cur_left,
    4737           0 :                                                   floats_cur_right);
    4738           0 :         if (floats_cur > floats_done) {
    4739           0 :           floats_done = floats_cur;
    4740             :         }
    4741           0 :         if (breakType != StyleClear::Right) {
    4742           0 :           floats_cur_left = 0;
    4743             :         }
    4744           0 :         if (breakType != StyleClear::Left) {
    4745           0 :           floats_cur_right = 0;
    4746             :         }
    4747             :       }

    4749           1 :       StyleFloat floatStyle = floatDisp->PhysicalFloats(wm);

    4751           1 :         floatStyle == StyleFloat::Left ? floats_cur_left : floats_cur_right;
    4752           1 :       nscoord floatWidth = floatInfo.Width();

    4754             :       // shouldn't change our intrinsic line width either.
    4755             :       floats_cur =
    4756           1 :         NSCoordSaturatingAdd(floats_cur, std::max(0, floatWidth));
    4757             :     }
    4758             : 
    4759             :     nscoord floats_cur =
    4760           1 :       NSCoordSaturatingAdd(floats_cur_left, floats_cur_right);
    4761           1 :     if (floats_cur > floats_done)
    4762           1 :       floats_done = floats_cur;
    4763             : 
    4764           1 :     mCurrentLine = NSCoordSaturatingAdd(mCurrentLine, floats_done);
    4765             : 
    4766           1 :     if (aBreakType == StyleClear::Both) {
    4767           1 :       mFloats.Clear();
    4768             :     } else {
    4769             :       // If the break type does not clear all floats, it means there may
    4770             :       // be some floats whose isize should contribute to the intrinsic
    4771             :       // isize of the next line. The code here scans the current mFloats
    4772             :       // and keeps floats which are not cleared by this break. Note that
    4773             :       // floats may be cleared directly or indirectly. See below.
    4774             :       nsTArray<FloatInfo> newFloats;

    4776             :                  aBreakType == StyleClear::Right,
    4777             :                  "Other values should have been handled in other branches");

    4779           0 :         aBreakType == StyleClear::Left ? StyleFloat::Left : StyleFloat::Right;

    4781             :       // no longer any floats we need to keep. See below.
    4782           0 :       for (FloatInfo& floatInfo : Reversed(mFloats)) {
    4783           0 :         const nsStyleDisplay* floatDisp = floatInfo.Frame()->StyleDisplay();
    4784           0 :         if (floatDisp->PhysicalFloats(wm) != clearFloatType) {
    4785           0 :           newFloats.AppendElement(floatInfo);
    4786             :         } else {
    4787             :           // This is a float on the side that this break directly clears
    4788             :           // which means we're not keeping it in mFloats. However, if
    4789             :           // this float clears floats on the opposite side (via a value
    4790             :           // of either 'both' or one of 'left'/'right'), any remaining
    4791             :           // (earlier) floats on that side would be indirectly cleared
    4792             :           // as well. Thus, we should break out of this loop and stop
    4793             :           // considering earlier floats to be kept in mFloats.
    4794           0 :           StyleClear floatBreakType = floatDisp->PhysicalBreakType(wm);
    4795           0 :           if (floatBreakType != aBreakType &&
    4796           0 :               floatBreakType != StyleClear::None) {
    4797             :             break;
    4798             :           }
    4799             :         }
    4800             :       }
    4801           0 :       newFloats.Reverse();
    4802           0 :       mFloats = Move(newFloats);
    4803             :     }
    4804             :   }
    4805             : 
    4806             :   mCurrentLine =
    4807           1 :     NSCoordSaturatingSubtract(mCurrentLine, mTrailingWhitespace, nscoord_MAX);

    4810           1 :   mSkipWhitespace = true;
    4811           1 :   mLineIsEmpty = true;

    4844             :     }
    4845             :     default: {
    4846             :       return;
    4847             :     }
    4848             :   }

    4851             : static nsIFrame::IntrinsicISizeOffsetData
    4852           1 : IntrinsicSizeOffsets(nsIFrame* aFrame, bool aForISize)

    4854           1 :   nsIFrame::IntrinsicISizeOffsetData result;

    4866             :

    4869             :                         : stylePadding->mPadding.GetLeft(),
    4870             :            aFrame, &result.hPadding, &result.hPctPadding,
    4871           1 :            true);
    4872             :   AddCoord(verticalAxis ? stylePadding->mPadding.GetBottom()
    4873             :                         : stylePadding->mPadding.GetRight(),

    4875           1 :            true);
    4876             : 
    4877           1 :   const nsStyleBorder* styleBorder = aFrame->StyleBorder();

    4881             :   } else {
    4882           1 :     result.hBorder += styleBorder->GetComputedBorderWidth(eSideLeft);

    4908           1 :   return result;
    4909             : }
    4910             :

    4934             : 
    4935             : /* virtual */
    4936             : LogicalSize
    4937           1 : nsFrame::ComputeSize(nsRenderingContext* aRenderingContext,
    4938             :                      WritingMode         aWM,

    4945             : {

    4950             :                                        aCBSize, aAvailableISize,

    4955             :   LogicalSize boxSizingAdjust(aWM);

    4963           1 :   const nsStyleCoord* inlineStyleCoord = &stylePos->ISize(aWM);

    4971           1 :       GetType() == nsGkAtoms::tableFrame) {

    4981             :       // container's justify/align-items value and WritingMode.

    4985           1 :   bool isFlexItem = (parentFrameType == nsGkAtoms::flexContainerFrame &&

    4987           1 :   bool isInlineFlexItem = false;
    4988           1 :   if (isFlexItem) {
    4989             :     // Flex items use their "flex-basis" property in place of their main-size
    4990             :     // property (e.g. "width") for sizing purposes, *unless* they have
    4991             :     // "flex-basis:auto", in which case they use their main-size property after
    4992             :     // all.

    4998             :     // NOTE: The logic here should match the similar chunk for determining
    4999             :     // inlineStyleCoord and blockStyleCoord in
    5000             :     // nsFrame::ComputeSizeWithIntrinsicDimensions().

    5002           1 :     if (flexBasis->GetUnit() != eStyleUnit_Auto) {
    5003           1 :       if (isInlineFlexItem) {
    5004             :         inlineStyleCoord = flexBasis;
    5005             :       } else {
    5006             :         // One caveat for vertical flex items: We don't support enumerated
    5007             :         // values (e.g. "max-content") for height properties yet. So, if our
    5008             :         // computed flex-basis is an enumerated value, we'll just behave as if
    5009             :         // it were "auto", which means "use the main-size property after all"

    5020             :   // Compute inline-axis size

    5028           1 :              !IS_TRUE_OVERFLOW_CONTAINER(this)) {

    5030             :     // 'normal' and clamp it to the CB if requested:
    5031           1 :     bool stretch = false;

    5034             :       auto inlineAxisAlignment =

    5037           1 :           StylePosition()->UsedJustifySelf(alignCB->StyleContext());
    5038           1 :       stretch = inlineAxisAlignment == NS_STYLE_ALIGN_NORMAL ||
    5039           1 :                 inlineAxisAlignment == NS_STYLE_ALIGN_STRETCH;
    5040             :     }
    5041           1 :     if (stretch || (aFlags & ComputeSizeFlags::eIClampMarginBoxMinSize)) {
    5042           1 :       auto iSizeToFillCB = std::max(nscoord(0), aCBSize.ISize(aWM) -

    5045           1 :                                                 aMargin.ISize(aWM));

    5051             : 
    5052             :   // Flex items ignore their min & max sizing properties in their

    5072           1 :                         boxSizingAdjust.ISize(aWM), boxSizingToMarginEdgeISize,
    5073           1 :                         minISizeCoord, aFlags);
    5074           1 :   } else if (MOZ_UNLIKELY(isGridItem)) {
    5075             :     // This implements "Implied Minimum Size of Grid Items".
    5076             :     // https://drafts.csswg.org/css-grid/#min-size-auto
    5077           1 :     minISize = std::min(maxISize, GetMinISize(aRenderingContext));
    5078           1 :     if (inlineStyleCoord->IsCoordPercentCalcUnit()) {
    5079           1 :       minISize = std::min(minISize, result.ISize(aWM));
    5080           1 :     } else if (aFlags & eIClampMarginBoxMinSize) {
    5081             :       // "if the grid item spans only grid tracks that have a fixed max track

    5083             :       // further clamped to less than or equal to the size necessary to fit

    5090           1 :       minISize = std::min(minISize, maxMinISize);
    5091             :     }

    5093             :     // Treat "min-width: auto" as 0.

    5097             :     // container explicitly considers them during space distribution.

    5169           1 :     bool canOverride = true;
    5170           1 :     nsPresContext *presContext = PresContext();

    5172             :       GetMinimumWidgetSize(presContext, this, disp->UsedAppearance(),

    5176             :     LogicalSize size(aWM,

    5194             : 
    5195           1 :   return result;
    5196             : }
    5197             : 
    5198             : LogicalSize
    5199           1 : nsFrame::ComputeSizeWithIntrinsicDimensions(nsRenderingContext*  aRenderingContext,
    5200             :                                             WritingMode          aWM,
    5201             :                                             const IntrinsicSize& aIntrinsicSize,
    5202             :                                             nsSize               aIntrinsicRatio,
    5203             :                                             const LogicalSize&   aCBSize,
    5204             :                                             const LogicalSize&   aMargin,
    5205             :                                             const LogicalSize&   aBorder,
    5206             :                                             const LogicalSize&   aPadding,
    5207             :                                             ComputeSizeFlags     aFlags)
    5208             : {
    5209           1 :   const nsStylePosition* stylePos = StylePosition();
    5210           1 :   const nsStyleCoord* inlineStyleCoord = &stylePos->ISize(aWM);
    5211           1 :   const nsStyleCoord* blockStyleCoord = &stylePos->BSize(aWM);
    5212             :   const nsIAtom* parentFrameType =
    5213           1 :     GetParent() ? GetParent()->GetType() : nullptr;
    5214           1 :   const bool isGridItem = (parentFrameType == nsGkAtoms::gridContainerFrame &&
    5215           1 :                            !(GetStateBits() & NS_FRAME_OUT_OF_FLOW));
    5216           1 :   const bool isFlexItem = (parentFrameType == nsGkAtoms::flexContainerFrame &&
    5217           1 :                            !(GetStateBits() & NS_FRAME_OUT_OF_FLOW));
    5218           1 :   bool isInlineFlexItem = false;
    5219             :   Maybe<nsStyleCoord> imposedMainSizeStyleCoord;
    5220             : 
    5221             :   // If this is a flex item, and we're measuring its cross size after flexing
    5222             :   // to resolve its main size, then we need to use the resolved main size
    5223             :   // that the container provides to us *instead of* the main-size coordinate
    5224             :   // from our style struct. (Otherwise, we'll be using an irrelevant value in
    5225             :   // the aspect-ratio calculations below.)
    5226           1 :   if (isFlexItem) {
    5227             :     uint32_t flexDirection =
    5228           1 :       GetParent()->StylePosition()->mFlexDirection;
    5229             :     isInlineFlexItem =
    5230             :       flexDirection == NS_STYLE_FLEX_DIRECTION_ROW ||
    5231           1 :       flexDirection == NS_STYLE_FLEX_DIRECTION_ROW_REVERSE;
    5232             : 
    5233             :     // If FlexItemMainSizeOverride frame-property is set, then that means the
    5234             :     // flex container is imposing a main-size on this flex item for it to use
    5235             :     // as its size in the container's main axis.
    5236           1 :     FrameProperties props = Properties();
    5237             :     bool didImposeMainSize;
    5238             :     nscoord imposedMainSize =
    5239           1 :       props.Get(nsIFrame::FlexItemMainSizeOverride(), &didImposeMainSize);
    5240           1 :     if (didImposeMainSize) {
    5241             :       imposedMainSizeStyleCoord.emplace(imposedMainSize,
    5242           1 :                                         nsStyleCoord::CoordConstructor);
    5243           1 :       if (isInlineFlexItem) {
    5244             :         inlineStyleCoord = imposedMainSizeStyleCoord.ptr();
    5245             :       } else {
    5246           1 :         blockStyleCoord = imposedMainSizeStyleCoord.ptr();
    5247             :       }
    5248             : 
    5249             :     } else {
    5250             :       // Flex items use their "flex-basis" property in place of their main-size
    5251             :       // property (e.g. "width") for sizing purposes, *unless* they have
    5252             :       // "flex-basis:auto", in which case they use their main-size property
    5253             :       // after all.
    5254             :       // NOTE: The logic here should match the similar chunk for determining
    5255             :       // inlineStyleCoord and blockStyleCoord in nsFrame::ComputeSize().
    5256           1 :       const nsStyleCoord* flexBasis = &(stylePos->mFlexBasis);
    5257           1 :       if (flexBasis->GetUnit() != eStyleUnit_Auto) {
    5258           0 :         if (isInlineFlexItem) {
    5259             :           inlineStyleCoord = flexBasis;
    5260             :         } else {
    5261             :           // One caveat for vertical flex items: We don't support enumerated
    5262             :           // values (e.g. "max-content") for height properties yet. So, if our
    5263             :           // computed flex-basis is an enumerated value, we'll just behave as if
    5264             :           // it were "auto", which means "use the main-size property after all"
    5265             :           // (which is "height", in this case).
    5266             :           // NOTE: Once we support intrinsic sizing keywords for "height",
    5267             :           // we should remove this check.
    5268           0 :           if (flexBasis->GetUnit() != eStyleUnit_Enumerated) {
    5269           0 :             blockStyleCoord = flexBasis;
    5270             :           }
    5271             :         }
    5272             :       }
    5273             :     }
    5274             :   }
    5275             : 
    5276             :   // Handle intrinsic sizes and their interaction with
    5277             :   // {min-,max-,}{width,height} according to the rules in
    5278             :   // http://www.w3.org/TR/CSS21/visudet.html#min-max-widths
    5279             : 
    5280             :   // Note: throughout the following section of the function, I avoid
    5281             :   // a * (b / c) because of its reduced accuracy relative to a * b / c
    5282             :   // or (a * b) / c (which are equivalent).
    5283             : 
    5284           1 :   const bool isAutoISize = inlineStyleCoord->GetUnit() == eStyleUnit_Auto;
    5285             :   const bool isAutoBSize =
    5286           1 :     nsLayoutUtils::IsAutoBSize(*blockStyleCoord, aCBSize.BSize(aWM));
    5287             : 
    5288             :   LogicalSize boxSizingAdjust(aWM);
    5289           1 :   if (stylePos->mBoxSizing == StyleBoxSizing::Border) {
    5290           1 :     boxSizingAdjust = aBorder + aPadding;
    5291             :   }

    5712             :                             ComputeSizeFlags    aFlags)

    5715             :   LAYOUT_WARN_IF_FALSE(aContainingBlockISize != NS_UNCONSTRAINEDSIZE,

    6044             : nsPoint
    6045           1 : nsIFrame::GetOffsetToCrossDoc(const nsIFrame* aOther, const int32_t aAPD) const
    6046             : {
    6047             :   NS_PRECONDITION(aOther,
    6048             :                   "Must have frame for destination coordinate system!");

    6054           1 :         aOther->PresContext()->GetRootPresContext()) {
    6055             :     // crash right away, we are almost certainly going to crash anyway.
    6056           0 :     MOZ_CRASH("trying to get the offset between frames in different "
    6057             :               "document hierarchies?");
    6058             :   }
    6059             : 
    6060           1 :   const nsIFrame* root = nullptr;
    6061             :   // offset will hold the final offset
    6062             :   // docOffset holds the currently accumulated offset at the current APD, it
    6063             :   // will be converted and added to offset when the current APD changes.
    6064             :   nsPoint offset(0, 0), docOffset(0, 0);
    6065           1 :   const nsIFrame* f = this;
    6066           1 :   int32_t currAPD = PresContext()->AppUnitsPerDevPixel();

    6068           1 :     docOffset += f->GetPosition();

    6071             :       f = parent;

    6078             :         // Convert docOffset to the right APD and add it to offset.
    6079           1 :         offset += docOffset.ScaleToOtherAppUnits(currAPD, aAPD);
    6080           1 :         docOffset.x = docOffset.y = 0;
    6081             :       }
    6082           1 :       currAPD = newAPD;
    6083           1 :       docOffset += newOffset;
    6084             :     }
    6085             :   }
    6086           1 :   if (f == aOther) {
    6087           1 :     offset += docOffset.ScaleToOtherAppUnits(currAPD, aAPD);
    6088             :   } else {
    6089             :     // Looks like aOther wasn't an ancestor of |this|.  So now we have
    6090             :     // the root-document-relative position of |this| in |offset|. Subtract the

    6095           1 :     offset -= negOffset;

    6097             : 
    6098           1 :   return offset;

    6185             : Matrix4x4
    6186           1 : nsIFrame::GetTransformMatrix(const nsIFrame* aStopAtAncestor,
    6187             :                              nsIFrame** aOutAncestor)
    6188             : {
    6189             :   NS_PRECONDITION(aOutAncestor, "Need a place to put the ancestor!");
    6190             : 
    6191             :   /* If we're transformed, we want to hand back the combination
    6192             :    * transform/translate matrix that will apply our current transform, then
    6193             :    * shift us to our parent.
    6194             :    */
    6195           1 :   if (IsTransformed()) {
    6196             :     /* Compute the delta to the parent, which we need because we are converting
    6197             :      * coordinates to our parent.
    6198             :      */
    6199             :     NS_ASSERTION(nsLayoutUtils::GetCrossDocParentFrame(this),
    6200             :                  "Cannot transform the viewport frame!");
    6201           1 :     int32_t scaleFactor = PresContext()->AppUnitsPerDevPixel();
    6202             : 
    6203             :     Matrix4x4 result = nsDisplayTransform::GetResultingTransformMatrix(this,
    6204             :                          nsPoint(0,0), scaleFactor,
    6205             :                          nsDisplayTransform::INCLUDE_PERSPECTIVE|nsDisplayTransform::OFFSET_BY_ORIGIN,
    6206           1 :                          nullptr);
    6207           1 :     *aOutAncestor = nsLayoutUtils::GetCrossDocParentFrame(this);
    6208           1 :     nsPoint delta = GetOffsetToCrossDoc(*aOutAncestor);
    6209             :     /* Combine the raw transform with a translation to our parent. */
    6210             :     result.PostTranslate(NSAppUnitsToFloatPixels(delta.x, scaleFactor),
    6211             :                          NSAppUnitsToFloatPixels(delta.y, scaleFactor),
    6212           1 :                          0.0f);
    6213             : 
    6214           1 :     return result;
    6215             :   }
    6216             : 
    6217           1 :   if (nsLayoutUtils::IsPopup(this) &&
    6218           1 :       GetType() == nsGkAtoms::listControlFrame) {
    6219           1 :     nsPresContext* presContext = PresContext();

    6221             : 
    6222             :     // Compute a matrix that transforms from the popup widget to the toplevel
    6223             :     // widget. We use the widgets because they're the simplest and most
    6224             :     // accurate approach --- this should work no matter how the widget position
    6225             :     // was chosen.
    6226           1 :     nsIWidget* widget = GetView()->GetWidget();
    6227           1 :     nsPresContext* rootPresContext = PresContext()->GetRootPresContext();

    6229             :     // treated as regular frames. That should work since they'll be rendered
    6230             :     // as part of the page if they're rendered at all.

    6232           1 :       nsIWidget* toplevel = rootPresContext->GetNearestWidget();

    6234           1 :         LayoutDeviceIntRect screenBounds = widget->GetClientBounds();

    6237           1 :           screenBounds.TopLeft() - toplevelScreenBounds.TopLeft();

    6239           1 :         Matrix4x4 transformToTop;

    6245           1 :           nsLayoutUtils::GetTransformToAncestor(docRootFrame, nullptr);
    6246           1 :         if (docRootTransformToTop.IsSingular()) {
    6247             :           NS_WARNING("Containing document is invisible, we can't compute a valid transform");
    6248             :         } else {
    6249           1 :           docRootTransformToTop.Invert();

    6251             :         }
    6252             :       }
    6253             :     }
    6254             :   }
    6255             : 
    6256           1 :   *aOutAncestor = nsLayoutUtils::GetCrossDocParentFrame(this);
    6257             : 
    6258             :   /* Otherwise, we're not transformed.  In that case, we'll walk up the frame
    6259             :    * tree until we either hit the root frame or something that may be
    6260             :    * transformed.  We'll then change coordinates into that frame, since we're
    6261             :    * guaranteed that nothing in-between can be transformed.  First, however,
    6262             :    * we have to check to see if we have a parent.  If not, we'll set the
    6263             :    * outparam to null (indicating that there's nothing left) and will hand back
    6264             :    * the identity matrix.
    6265             :    */
    6266           1 :   if (!*aOutAncestor)
    6267           1 :     return Matrix4x4();
    6268             : 
    6269             :   /* Keep iterating while the frame can't possibly be transformed. */
    6270           1 :   while (!(*aOutAncestor)->IsTransformed() &&
    6271           1 :          !nsLayoutUtils::IsPopup(*aOutAncestor) &&
    6272           1 :          *aOutAncestor != aStopAtAncestor) {
    6273             :     /* If no parent, stop iterating.  Otherwise, update the ancestor. */
    6274           1 :     nsIFrame* parent = nsLayoutUtils::GetCrossDocParentFrame(*aOutAncestor);
    6275           1 :     if (!parent)
    6276             :       break;
    6277             : 
    6278           1 :     *aOutAncestor = parent;
    6279             :   }
    6280             : 
    6281             :   NS_ASSERTION(*aOutAncestor, "Somehow ended up with a null ancestor...?");
    6282             : 
    6283             :   /* Translate from this frame to our ancestor, if it exists.  That's the
    6284             :    * entire transform, so we're done.
    6285             :    */
    6286           1 :   nsPoint delta = GetOffsetToCrossDoc(*aOutAncestor);
    6287           1 :   int32_t scaleFactor = PresContext()->AppUnitsPerDevPixel();

    6290           1 :                                 0.0f);
