    6630             : static nsRect
    6631           1 : ComputeEffectsRect(nsIFrame* aFrame, const nsRect& aOverflowRect,
    6632             :                    const nsSize& aNewSize)
    6633             : {
    6634             :   nsRect r = aOverflowRect;
    6635             : 
    6636           1 :   if (aFrame->GetStateBits() & NS_FRAME_SVG_LAYOUT) {
    6637             :     // For SVG frames, we only need to account for filters.
    6638             :     // TODO: We could also take account of clipPath and mask to reduce the
    6639             :     // visual overflow, but that's not essential.
    6640           1 :     if (aFrame->StyleEffects()->HasFilters()) {
    6641             :       aFrame->Properties().
    6642           1 :         Set(nsIFrame::PreEffectsBBoxProperty(), new nsRect(r));
    6643           1 :       r = nsSVGUtils::GetPostFilterVisualOverflowRect(aFrame, aOverflowRect);
    6644             :     }
    6645             :     return r;
    6646             :   }
    6647             : 
    6648             :   // box-shadow
    6649           1 :   r.UnionRect(r, nsLayoutUtils::GetBoxShadowRectForFrame(aFrame, aNewSize));
    6650             : 
    6651             :   // border-image-outset.
    6652             :   // We need to include border-image-outset because it can cause the
    6653             :   // border image to be drawn beyond the border box.
    6654             : 
    6655             :   // (1) It's important we not check whether there's a border-image
    6656             :   //     since the style hint for a change in border image doesn't cause
    6657             :   //     reflow, and that's probably more important than optimizing the
    6658             :   //     overflow areas for the silly case of border-image-outset without
    6659             :   //     border-image
    6660             :   // (2) It's important that we not check whether the border-image
    6661             :   //     is actually loaded, since that would require us to reflow when
    6662             :   //     the image loads.
    6663           1 :   const nsStyleBorder* styleBorder = aFrame->StyleBorder();
    6664           1 :   nsMargin outsetMargin = styleBorder->GetImageOutset();
    6665             : 
    6666           1 :   if (outsetMargin != nsMargin(0, 0, 0, 0)) {
    6667             :     nsRect outsetRect(nsPoint(0, 0), aNewSize);
    6668           1 :     outsetRect.Inflate(outsetMargin);
    6669           1 :     r.UnionRect(r, outsetRect);
    6670             :   }
    6671             : 
    6672             :   // Note that we don't remove the outlineInnerRect if a frame loses outline
    6673             :   // style. That would require an extra property lookup for every frame,
    6674             :   // or a new frame state bit to track whether a property had been stored,
    6675             :   // or something like that. It's not worth doing that here. At most it's
    6676             :   // only one heap-allocated rect per frame and it will be cleaned up when
    6677             :   // the frame dies.
    6678             : 
    6679           1 :   if (nsSVGIntegrationUtils::UsingEffectsForFrame(aFrame)) {
    6680             :     aFrame->Properties().
    6681           1 :       Set(nsIFrame::PreEffectsBBoxProperty(), new nsRect(r));
    6682           1 :     r = nsSVGIntegrationUtils::ComputePostEffectsVisualOverflowRect(aFrame, r);
    6683             :   }
    6684             : 
    6685             :   return r;
    6686             : }
    6687             : 
    6688             : void
    6689           1 : nsIFrame::MovePositionBy(const nsPoint& aTranslation)

    6741             :   // updated (yet) to reflect any outline set on the frame or the area

    6743             :   // areas will invalidate the appropriate area, so any (mis)uses of
    6744             :   // this method will be fixed up.

    6922             : 
    6923             : static nsIFrame*
    6924           1 : GetNearestBlockContainer(nsIFrame* frame)
    6925             : {
    6926             :   // The block wrappers we use to wrap blocks inside inlines aren't
    6927             :   // described in the CSS spec.  We need to make them not be containing
    6928             :   // blocks.
    6929             :   // Since the parent of such a block is either a normal block or
    6930             :   // another such pseudo, this shouldn't cause anything bad to happen.
    6931             :   // Also the anonymous blocks inside table cells are not containing blocks.
    6932           1 :   while (frame->IsFrameOfType(nsIFrame::eLineParticipant) ||
    6933           1 :          frame->IsBlockWrapper() ||
    6934             :          // Table rows are not containing blocks either
    6935           1 :          frame->GetType() == nsGkAtoms::tableRowFrame) {
    6936           1 :     frame = frame->GetParent();
    6937             :     NS_ASSERTION(frame, "How come we got to the root frame without seeing a containing block?");
    6938             :   }
    6939           1 :   return frame;
    6940             : }
    6941             : 
    6942             : nsIFrame*
    6943           1 : nsIFrame::GetContainingBlock(uint32_t aFlags) const
    6944             : {
    6945           1 :   if (!GetParent()) {
    6946             :     return nullptr;
    6947             :   }

    6949             :   // still be in-flow.  So we have to check to make sure that the frame
    6950             :   // is really out-of-flow too.

    6953           1 :       (GetStateBits() & NS_FRAME_OUT_OF_FLOW)) {
    6954           1 :     f = GetParent(); // the parent is always the containing block
    6955             :   } else {
    6956           1 :     f = GetNearestBlockContainer(GetParent());

    6961           1 :     f = f->GetParent();

    7007             : // Debugging
    7008             : void
    7009             : nsIFrame::ListGeneric(nsACString& aTo, const char* aPrefix, uint32_t aFlags) const
    7010             : {
    7011             :   aTo =+ aPrefix;
    7012             :   ListTag(aTo);
    7013             :   if (HasView()) {
    7014             :     aTo += nsPrintfCString(" [view=%p]", static_cast<void*>(GetView()));
    7015             :   }
    7016             :   if (GetNextSibling()) {
    7017             :     aTo += nsPrintfCString(" next=%p", static_cast<void*>(GetNextSibling()));
    7018             :   }
    7019             :   if (GetPrevContinuation()) {
    7020             :     bool fluid = GetPrevInFlow() == GetPrevContinuation();
    7021             :     aTo += nsPrintfCString(" prev-%s=%p", fluid?"in-flow":"continuation",
    7022             :             static_cast<void*>(GetPrevContinuation()));
    7023             :   }
    7024             :   if (GetNextContinuation()) {
    7025             :     bool fluid = GetNextInFlow() == GetNextContinuation();
    7026             :     aTo += nsPrintfCString(" next-%s=%p", fluid?"in-flow":"continuation",
    7027             :             static_cast<void*>(GetNextContinuation()));
    7028             :   }
    7029             :   void* IBsibling = Properties().Get(IBSplitSibling());
    7030             :   if (IBsibling) {
    7031             :     aTo += nsPrintfCString(" IBSplitSibling=%p", IBsibling);
    7032             :   }
    7033             :   void* IBprevsibling = Properties().Get(IBSplitPrevSibling());
    7034             :   if (IBprevsibling) {
    7035             :     aTo += nsPrintfCString(" IBSplitPrevSibling=%p", IBprevsibling);
    7036             :   }
    7037             :   aTo += nsPrintfCString(" {%d,%d,%d,%d}", mRect.x, mRect.y, mRect.width, mRect.height);
    7038             : 
    7039             :   mozilla::WritingMode wm = GetWritingMode();
    7040             :   if (wm.IsVertical() || !wm.IsBidiLTR()) {
    7041             :     aTo += nsPrintfCString(" wm=%s: logical size={%d,%d}", wm.DebugString(),
    7042             :                            ISize(), BSize());
    7043             :   }
    7044             : 
    7045             :   nsIFrame* parent = GetParent();

    7047             :     WritingMode pWM = parent->GetWritingMode();

    7049             :       nsSize containerSize = parent->mRect.Size();

    7051             :       aTo += nsPrintfCString(" parent wm=%s, cs={%d,%d}, "

    7055             :                              lr.IStart(pWM), lr.BStart(pWM),
    7056             :                              lr.ISize(pWM), lr.BSize(pWM));
    7057             :     }
    7058             :   }

    7061             :     nsRect vo = f->GetVisualOverflowRect();
    7062             :     if (!vo.IsEqualEdges(mRect)) {

    7064             :     }
    7065             :     nsRect so = f->GetScrollableOverflowRect();

    7068             :     }
    7069             :   }

    7072             :   }

    7074             :     aTo += nsPrintfCString(" transformed");
    7075             :   }

    7077             :     aTo += nsPrintfCString(" perspective");

    7090             :     nsIAtom* pseudoTag = mStyleContext->GetPseudo();

    7093             :       pseudoTag->ToString(atomString);
    7094             :       aTo += nsPrintfCString("%s", NS_LossyConvertUTF16toASCII(atomString).get());

    7106             :       }
    7107             :     }

    7161             : void

    7163             : {

    7176             : 
    7177             : #ifdef DEBUG
    7178             : nsFrameState
    7179             : nsFrame::GetDebugStateBits() const
    7180             : {
    7181             :   // We'll ignore these flags for the purposes of comparing frame state:
    7182             :   //
    7183             :   //   NS_FRAME_EXTERNAL_REFERENCE
    7184             :   //     because this is set by the event state manager or the
    7185             :   //     caret code when a frame is focused. Depending on whether
    7186             :   //     or not the regression tests are run as the focused window
    7187             :   //     will make this value vary randomly.
    7188             : #define IRRELEVANT_FRAME_STATE_FLAGS NS_FRAME_EXTERNAL_REFERENCE
    7189             : 
    7190             : #define FRAME_STATE_MASK (~(IRRELEVANT_FRAME_STATE_FLAGS))
    7191             : 
    7192             :   return GetStateBits() & FRAME_STATE_MASK;
    7193             : }
    7194             : 
    7195             : void
    7196             : nsFrame::XMLQuote(nsString& aString)
    7197             : {
    7198             :   int32_t i, len = aString.Length();
    7199             :   for (i = 0; i < len; i++) {
    7200             :     char16_t ch = aString.CharAt(i);
    7201             :     if (ch == '<') {
    7202             :       nsAutoString tmp(NS_LITERAL_STRING("&lt;"));
    7203             :       aString.Cut(i, 1);
    7204             :       aString.Insert(tmp, i);
    7205             :       len += 3;
    7206             :       i += 3;
    7207             :     }
    7208             :     else if (ch == '>') {
    7209             :       nsAutoString tmp(NS_LITERAL_STRING("&gt;"));

    7211             :       aString.Insert(tmp, i);
    7212             :       len += 3;
    7213             :       i += 3;

    7220             :       i += 5;

    7460             : nsresult
    7461           1 : nsFrame::GetChildFrameContainingOffset(int32_t inContentOffset, bool inHint, int32_t* outFrameContentOffset, nsIFrame **outChildFrame)
    7462             : {

    7475             :   }
    7476           1 :   *outChildFrame = this;
    7477           1 :   return NS_OK;
    7478             : }
    7479             : 
    7480             : //
    7481             : // What I've pieced together about this routine:
    7482             : // Starting with a block frame (from which a line frame can be gotten)
    7483             : // and a line number, drill down and get the first/last selectable
    7484             : // frame on that line, depending on aPos->mDirection.
    7485             : // aOutSideLimit != 0 means ignore aLineStart, instead work from
    7486             : // the end (if > 0) or beginning (if < 0).
    7487             : //
    7488             : nsresult
    7489           1 : nsFrame::GetNextPrevLineFromeBlockFrame(nsPresContext* aPresContext,
    7490             :                                         nsPeekOffsetStruct *aPos,
    7491             :                                         nsIFrame *aBlockFrame, 
    7492             :                                         int32_t aLineStart, 
    7493             :                                         int8_t aOutSideLimit
    7494             :                                         )
    7495             : {
    7496             :   //magic numbers aLineStart will be -1 for end of block 0 will be start of block
    7497           1 :   if (!aBlockFrame || !aPos)
    7498             :     return NS_ERROR_NULL_POINTER;
    7499             : 
    7500           1 :   aPos->mResultFrame = nullptr;
    7501           1 :   aPos->mResultContent = nullptr;
    7502             :   aPos->mAttach =
    7503           1 :       aPos->mDirection == eDirNext ? CARET_ASSOCIATE_AFTER : CARET_ASSOCIATE_BEFORE;
    7504             : 
    7505           1 :   nsAutoLineIterator it = aBlockFrame->GetLineIterator();
    7506           1 :   if (!it)
    7507             :     return NS_ERROR_FAILURE;
    7508           1 :   int32_t searchingLine = aLineStart;
    7509           1 :   int32_t countLines = it->GetNumLines();
    7510           1 :   if (aOutSideLimit > 0) //start at end
    7511             :     searchingLine = countLines;
    7512           1 :   else if (aOutSideLimit <0)//start at beginning
    7513             :     searchingLine = -1;//"next" will be 0  
    7514             :   else 
    7515           1 :     if ((aPos->mDirection == eDirPrevious && searchingLine == 0) || 
    7516           1 :        (aPos->mDirection == eDirNext && searchingLine >= (countLines -1) )){
    7517             :       //we need to jump to new block frame.
    7518             :            return NS_ERROR_FAILURE;
    7519             :     }
    7520             :   int32_t lineFrameCount;
    7521           1 :   nsIFrame *resultFrame = nullptr;
    7522           1 :   nsIFrame *farStoppingFrame = nullptr; //we keep searching until we find a "this" frame then we go to next line
    7523           1 :   nsIFrame *nearStoppingFrame = nullptr; //if we are backing up from edge, stop here
    7524             :   nsIFrame *firstFrame;
    7525             :   nsIFrame *lastFrame;
    7526             :   nsRect  rect;
    7527             :   bool isBeforeFirstFrame, isAfterLastFrame;
    7528           1 :   bool found = false;
    7529             : 
    7530           1 :   nsresult result = NS_OK;
    7531           1 :   while (!found)
    7532             :   {
    7533           1 :     if (aPos->mDirection == eDirPrevious)
    7534           1 :       searchingLine --;
    7535             :     else
    7536           1 :       searchingLine ++;
    7537           1 :     if ((aPos->mDirection == eDirPrevious && searchingLine < 0) || 
    7538           1 :        (aPos->mDirection == eDirNext && searchingLine >= countLines ))
    7539             :     {
    7540             :       //we need to jump to new block frame.
    7541             :       return NS_ERROR_FAILURE;
    7542             :     }
    7543             :     result = it->GetLine(searchingLine, &firstFrame, &lineFrameCount,
    7544           1 :                          rect);
    7545           1 :     if (!lineFrameCount) 
    7546             :       continue;
    7547           1 :     if (NS_SUCCEEDED(result)){
    7548           1 :       lastFrame = firstFrame;
    7549           1 :       for (;lineFrameCount > 1;lineFrameCount --){
    7550             :         //result = lastFrame->GetNextSibling(&lastFrame, searchingLine);
    7551           1 :         result = it->GetNextSiblingOnLine(lastFrame, searchingLine);
    7552           1 :         if (NS_FAILED(result) || !lastFrame){
    7553             :           NS_ERROR("GetLine promised more frames than could be found");
    7554           0 :           return NS_ERROR_FAILURE;
    7555             :         }
    7556             :       }
    7557           1 :       GetLastLeaf(aPresContext, &lastFrame);
    7558             : 
    7559           1 :       if (aPos->mDirection == eDirNext){

    7562             :       }

    7564           1 :         nearStoppingFrame = lastFrame;

    7709             :         {

    7758             : // Find the first (or last) descendant of the given frame
    7759             : // which is either a block frame or a BRFrame.
    7760             : static nsContentAndOffset
    7761           1 : FindBlockFrameOrBR(nsIFrame* aFrame, nsDirection aDirection)
    7762             : {

    7775             :

    7822             : nsresult
    7823           1 : nsIFrame::PeekOffsetParagraph(nsPeekOffsetStruct *aPos)
    7824             : {
    7825           1 :   nsIFrame* frame = this;

    7829             : 
    7830             :   // Go through containing frames until reaching a block frame.
    7831             :   // In each step, search the previous (or next) siblings for the closest
    7832             :   // "stop frame" (a block frame or a BRFrame).

    7836           1 :     while (!reachedBlockAncestor) {

    8624             : /** Set the overflowArea rect, storing it as deltas or a separate rect

    8626             :  */
    8627             : bool
    8628           1 : nsIFrame::SetOverflowAreas(const nsOverflowAreas& aOverflowAreas)
    8629             : {
    8630           1 :   if (mOverflow.mType == NS_FRAME_OVERFLOW_LARGE) {
    8631           1 :     nsOverflowAreas* overflow = Properties().Get(OverflowAreasProperty());
    8632           1 :     bool changed = *overflow != aOverflowAreas;
    8633           1 :     *overflow = aOverflowAreas;
    8634             : 
    8635             :     // Don't bother with converting to the deltas form if we already
    8636             :     // have a property.
    8637           1 :     return changed;
    8638             :   }
    8639             : 
    8640           1 :   const nsRect& vis = aOverflowAreas.VisualOverflow();
    8641           1 :   uint32_t l = -vis.x, // left edge: positive delta is leftwards
    8642           1 :            t = -vis.y, // top: positive is upwards
    8643           1 :            r = vis.XMost() - mRect.width, // right: positive is rightwards
    8644           1 :            b = vis.YMost() - mRect.height; // bottom: positive is downwards
    8645           1 :   if (aOverflowAreas.ScrollableOverflow().IsEqualEdges(nsRect(nsPoint(0, 0), GetSize())) &&
    8646           1 :       l <= NS_FRAME_OVERFLOW_DELTA_MAX &&
    8647           1 :       t <= NS_FRAME_OVERFLOW_DELTA_MAX &&
    8648           1 :       r <= NS_FRAME_OVERFLOW_DELTA_MAX &&
    8649           1 :       b <= NS_FRAME_OVERFLOW_DELTA_MAX &&
    8650             :       // we have to check these against zero because we *never* want to
    8651             :       // set a frame as having no overflow in this function.  This is
    8652             :       // because FinishAndStoreOverflow calls this function prior to
    8653             :       // SetRect based on whether the overflow areas match aNewSize.
    8654             :       // In the case where the overflow areas exactly match mRect but
    8655             :       // do not match aNewSize, we need to store overflow in a property
    8656             :       // so that our eventual SetRect/SetSize will know that it has to
    8657             :       // reset our overflow areas.
    8658           1 :       (l | t | r | b) != 0) {
    8659           1 :     VisualDeltas oldDeltas = mOverflow.mVisualDeltas;
    8660             :     // It's a "small" overflow area so we store the deltas for each edge
    8661             :     // directly in the frame, rather than allocating a separate rect.
    8662             :     // If they're all zero, that's fine; we're setting things to
    8663             :     // no-overflow.
    8664           1 :     mOverflow.mVisualDeltas.mLeft   = l;
    8665           1 :     mOverflow.mVisualDeltas.mTop    = t;
    8666           1 :     mOverflow.mVisualDeltas.mRight  = r;
    8667           1 :     mOverflow.mVisualDeltas.mBottom = b;
    8668             :     // There was no scrollable overflow before, and there isn't now.
    8669           1 :     return oldDeltas != mOverflow.mVisualDeltas;
    8670             :   } else {
    8671           1 :     bool changed = !aOverflowAreas.ScrollableOverflow().IsEqualEdges(nsRect(nsPoint(0, 0), GetSize())) ||

    8673             : 
    8674             :     // it's a large overflow area that we need to store as a property
    8675           1 :     mOverflow.mType = NS_FRAME_OVERFLOW_LARGE;
    8676           1 :     nsOverflowAreas* overflow = GetOverflowAreasProperty();
    8677             :     NS_ASSERTION(overflow, "should have created areas");
    8678           1 :     *overflow = aOverflowAreas;
    8679           1 :     return changed;
    8680             :   }
    8681             : }
    8682             : 
    8683             : inline bool
    8684           1 : IsInlineFrame(nsIFrame *aFrame)
    8685             : {
    8686           1 :   nsIAtom *type = aFrame->GetType();
    8687           1 :   return type == nsGkAtoms::inlineFrame;
    8688             : }
    8689             : 
    8690             : /**
    8691             :  * Compute the union of the border boxes of aFrame and its descendants,
    8692             :  * in aFrame's coordinate space (if aApplyTransform is false) or its
    8693             :  * post-transform coordinate space (if aApplyTransform is true).
    8694             :  */
    8695             : static nsRect
    8696           1 : UnionBorderBoxes(nsIFrame* aFrame, bool aApplyTransform,
    8697             :                  bool& aOutValid,
    8698             :                  const nsSize* aSizeOverride = nullptr,
    8699             :                  const nsOverflowAreas* aOverflowOverride = nullptr)
    8700             : {
    8701             :   const nsRect bounds(nsPoint(0, 0),
    8702           1 :                       aSizeOverride ? *aSizeOverride : aFrame->GetSize());

    8704             :   // The SVG container frames besides SVGTextFrame do not maintain
    8705             :   // an accurate mRect. It will make the outline be larger than
    8706             :   // we expect, we need to make them narrow to their children's outline.
    8707             :   // aOutValid is set to false if the returned nsRect is not valid
    8708             :   // and should not be included in the outline rectangle.

    8715           1 :   if (!aFrame->FrameMaintainsOverflow()) {

    8768           1 :       nsIFrame* child = e.get();

    8770             :       // child->Combines3DTransformWithAncestors() is incorrect if our

    8773             :       // are always transformed up to the top of the scene.  This

    8815             : static void
    8816           1 : ComputeAndIncludeOutlineArea(nsIFrame* aFrame, nsOverflowAreas& aOverflowAreas,

    8903             : bool
    8904           1 : nsIFrame::FinishAndStoreOverflow(nsOverflowAreas& aOverflowAreas,

    8939             :   // This is now called FinishAndStoreOverflow() instead of 
    8940             :   // StoreOverflow() because frame-generic ways of adding overflow
    8941             :   // can happen here, e.g. CSS2 outline and native theme.

    8943             :   // saturating union may have encounted an overflow, so the overflow may not
    8944             :   // contain the frame border-box. Don't warn in that case.

    8954             :   }
    8955             : 
    8956             :   // If we clip our children, clear accumulated overflow area. The

    9073             : void
    9074           1 : nsIFrame::RecomputePerspectiveChildrenOverflow(const nsIFrame* aStartFrame)
    9075             : {
    9076           1 :   nsIFrame::ChildListIterator lists(this);
    9077           1 :   for (; !lists.IsDone(); lists.Next()) {
    9078           1 :     nsFrameList::Enumerator childFrames(lists.CurrentList());
    9079           1 :     for (; !childFrames.AtEnd(); childFrames.Next()) {
    9080           1 :       nsIFrame* child = childFrames.get();
    9081           1 :       if (!child->FrameMaintainsOverflow()) {
    9082             :         continue; // frame does not maintain overflow rects
    9083             :       }
    9084           1 :       if (child->HasPerspective()) {
    9085             :         nsOverflowAreas* overflow = 
    9086           1 :           child->Properties().Get(nsIFrame::InitialOverflowProperty());
    9087           1 :         nsRect bounds(nsPoint(0, 0), child->GetSize());
    9088           1 :         if (overflow) {
    9089           0 :           nsOverflowAreas overflowCopy = *overflow;
    9090           0 :           child->FinishAndStoreOverflow(overflowCopy, bounds.Size());
    9091             :         } else {
    9092           1 :           nsOverflowAreas boundsOverflow;
    9093           1 :           boundsOverflow.SetAllTo(bounds);
    9094           1 :           child->FinishAndStoreOverflow(boundsOverflow, bounds.Size());
    9095             :         }
    9096           1 :       } else if (child->GetContainingBlock(SKIP_SCROLLED_FRAME) == aStartFrame) {

    9098             :         // perspective-origin is the size of the frame belonging to its parent

    9102           1 :         child->RecomputePerspectiveChildrenOverflow(aStartFrame);

    9107             : 
    9108             : void
    9109           1 : nsIFrame::ComputePreserve3DChildrenOverflow(nsOverflowAreas& aOverflowAreas)
    9110             : {
    9111             :   // Find all descendants that participate in the 3d context, and include their overflow.
    9112             :   // These descendants have an empty overflow, so won't have been included in the normal
    9113             :   // overflow calculation. Any children that don't participate have normal overflow,
    9114             :   // so will have been included already.
    9115             : 
    9116             :   nsRect childVisual;
    9117             :   nsRect childScrollable;
    9118           1 :   nsIFrame::ChildListIterator lists(this);
    9119           1 :   for (; !lists.IsDone(); lists.Next()) {
    9120           1 :     nsFrameList::Enumerator childFrames(lists.CurrentList());

    9166             : /**
    9167             :  * This function takes a frame that is part of a block-in-inline split,
    9168             :  * and _if_ that frame is an anonymous block created by an ib split it
    9169             :  * returns the block's preceding inline.  This is needed because the
    9170             :  * split inline's style context is the parent of the anonymous block's
    9171             :  * style context.
    9172             :  *
    9173             :  * If aFrame is not an anonymous block, null is returned.
    9174             :  */

    9202             : /**
    9203             :  * Get the parent, corrected for the mangled frame tree resulting from
    9204             :  * having a block within an inline.  The result only differs from the
    9205             :  * result of |GetParent| when |GetParent| returns an anonymous block
    9206             :  * that was created for an element that was 'display: inline' because
    9207             :  * that element contained a block.
    9208             :  *
    9209             :  * Also skip anonymous scrolled-content parents; inherit directly from the
    9210             :  * outer scroll frame.
    9211             :  *
    9212             :  * Also skip NAC parents if the child frame is NAC.
    9213             :  */
    9214             : static nsIFrame*
    9215           1 : GetCorrectedParent(const nsIFrame* aFrame)
    9216             : {
    9217           1 :   nsIFrame* parent = aFrame->GetParent();
    9218           1 :   if (!parent) {
    9219             :     return nullptr;
    9220             :   }
    9221             : 
    9222             :   // For a table caption we want the _inner_ table frame (unless it's anonymous)
    9223             :   // as the style parent.
    9224           1 :   if (aFrame->IsTableCaption()) {
    9225           1 :     nsIFrame* innerTable = parent->PrincipalChildList().FirstChild();
    9226           1 :     if (!innerTable->StyleContext()->GetPseudo()) {
    9227             :       return innerTable;
    9228             :     }
    9229             :   }
    9230             : 
    9231             :   // Table wrappers are always anon boxes; if we're in here for an outer
    9232             :   // table, that actually means its the _inner_ table that wants to
    9233             :   // know its parent. So get the pseudo of the inner in that case.
    9234           1 :   nsIAtom* pseudo = aFrame->StyleContext()->GetPseudo();
    9235           1 :   if (pseudo == nsCSSAnonBoxes::tableWrapper) {
    9236           1 :     pseudo = aFrame->PrincipalChildList().FirstChild()->StyleContext()->GetPseudo();
    9237             :   }
    9238             : 
    9239             :   // Prevent NAC from inheriting NAC. This partially duplicates the logic
    9240             :   // implemented in nsCSSFrameConstructor::AddFCItemsForAnonymousContent, and is
    9241             :   // necessary so that restyle inherits style contexts in the same way as the
    9242             :   // initial styling performed in frame construction.
    9243             :   //
    9244             :   // It would be nice to put it in CorrectStyleParentFrame and therefore share
    9245             :   // it, but that would lose the information of whether the _child_ is NAC,
    9246             :   // since CorrectStyleParentFrame only knows about the prospective _parent_.
    9247             :   // This duplication and complexity will go away when we fully switch to the
    9248             :   // Servo style system, where all this can be handled much more naturally.
    9249             :   //
    9250             :   // We need to take special care not to disrupt the style inheritance of frames
    9251             :   // whose content is NAC but who implement a pseudo (like an anonymous
    9252             :   // box, or a non-NAC-backed pseudo like ::first-line) that does not match the
    9253             :   // one that the NAC implements, if any.
    9254           1 :   nsIContent* content = aFrame->GetContent();

    9256           1 :     content && content->IsElement() ? content->AsElement() : nullptr;
    9257           1 :   if (element && element->IsNativeAnonymous() && !element->IsNativeScrollbarContent() &&

    9259           1 :     while (parent->GetContent() && parent->GetContent()->IsNativeAnonymous()) {
    9260           1 :       parent = parent->GetInFlowParent();
    9261             :     }
    9262             :   }
    9263             : 
    9264           1 :   return nsFrame::CorrectStyleParentFrame(parent, pseudo);
    9265             : }

    9447           1 : nsIFrame::IsFocusable(int32_t *aTabIndex, bool aWithMouse)
    9448             : {
    9449           1 :   int32_t tabIndex = -1;

    9451           1 :     *aTabIndex = -1; // Default for early return is not focusable
    9452             :   }

    9471             :       // Elements with scrollable view are focusable with script & tabbable
    9472             :       // Otherwise you couldn't scroll them with keyboard, which is
    9473             :       // an accessibility issue (e.g. Section 508 rules)
    9474             :       // However, we don't make them to be focusable with the mouse,
    9475             :       // because the extra focus outlines are considered unnecessarily ugly.
    9476             :       // When clicked on, the selection position within the element 
    9477             :       // will be enough to make them keyboard scrollable.
    9478           1 :       nsIScrollableFrame *scrollFrame = do_QueryFrame(this);

    9480           1 :           !scrollFrame->GetScrollbarStyles().IsHiddenInBothDirections() &&
    9481           1 :           !scrollFrame->GetScrollRange().IsEqualEdges(nsRect(0, 0, 0, 0))) {

    9490           1 :     *aTabIndex = tabIndex;
    9491             :   }

    9505             : static uint8_t
    9506             : ConvertSVGDominantBaselineToVerticalAlign(uint8_t aDominantBaseline)
    9507             : {
    9508             :   // Most of these are approximate mappings.
    9509             :   switch (aDominantBaseline) {
    9510             :   case NS_STYLE_DOMINANT_BASELINE_HANGING:
    9511             :   case NS_STYLE_DOMINANT_BASELINE_TEXT_BEFORE_EDGE:
    9512             :     return NS_STYLE_VERTICAL_ALIGN_TEXT_TOP;
    9513             :   case NS_STYLE_DOMINANT_BASELINE_TEXT_AFTER_EDGE:
    9514             :   case NS_STYLE_DOMINANT_BASELINE_IDEOGRAPHIC:
    9515             :     return NS_STYLE_VERTICAL_ALIGN_TEXT_BOTTOM;
    9516             :   case NS_STYLE_DOMINANT_BASELINE_CENTRAL:
    9517             :   case NS_STYLE_DOMINANT_BASELINE_MIDDLE:
    9518             :   case NS_STYLE_DOMINANT_BASELINE_MATHEMATICAL:
    9519             :     return NS_STYLE_VERTICAL_ALIGN_MIDDLE;
    9520             :   case NS_STYLE_DOMINANT_BASELINE_AUTO:
    9521             :   case NS_STYLE_DOMINANT_BASELINE_ALPHABETIC:
    9522             :     return NS_STYLE_VERTICAL_ALIGN_BASELINE;
    9523             :   case NS_STYLE_DOMINANT_BASELINE_USE_SCRIPT:
    9524             :   case NS_STYLE_DOMINANT_BASELINE_NO_CHANGE:
    9525             :   case NS_STYLE_DOMINANT_BASELINE_RESET_SIZE:
    9526             :     // These three should not simply map to 'baseline', but we don't
    9527             :     // support the complex baseline model that SVG 1.1 has and which
    9528             :     // css3-linebox now defines.
    9529             :     return NS_STYLE_VERTICAL_ALIGN_BASELINE;
    9530             :   default:
    9531             :     NS_NOTREACHED("unexpected aDominantBaseline value");
    9532             :     return NS_STYLE_VERTICAL_ALIGN_BASELINE;
    9533             :   }
    9534             : }

    9576             :       // let the consumer know.

    9589             : NS_IMETHODIMP
    9590           1 : nsFrame::RefreshSizeCache(nsBoxLayoutState& aState)
    9591             : {
    9592             :   // XXXbz this comment needs some rewriting to make sense in the
    9593             :   // post-reflow-branch world.
    9594             :   
    9595             :   // Ok we need to compute our minimum, preferred, and maximum sizes.
    9596             :   // 1) Maximum size. This is easy. Its infinite unless it is overloaded by CSS.
    9597             :   // 2) Preferred size. This is a little harder. This is the size the block would be 
    9598             :   //      if it were laid out on an infinite canvas. So we can get this by reflowing
    9599             :   //      the block with and INTRINSIC width and height. We can also do a nice optimization
    9600             :   //      for incremental reflow. If the reflow is incremental then we can pass a flag to 
    9601             :   //      have the block compute the preferred width for us! Preferred height can just be
    9602             :   //      the minimum height;
    9603             :   // 3) Minimum size. This is a toughy. We can pass the block a flag asking for the max element
    9604             :   //    size. That would give us the width. Unfortunately you can only ask for a maxElementSize
    9605             :   //    during an incremental reflow. So on other reflows we will just have to use 0.
    9606             :   //    The min height on the other hand is fairly easy we need to get the largest
    9607             :   //    line height. This can be done with the line iterator.
    9608             : 
    9609             :   // if we do have a rendering context
    9610           1 :   nsRenderingContext* rendContext = aState.GetRenderingContext();
    9611           1 :   if (rendContext) {
    9612           1 :     nsPresContext* presContext = aState.PresContext();
    9613             : 
    9614             :     // If we don't have any HTML constraints and it's a resize, then nothing in the block
    9615             :     // could have changed, so no refresh is necessary.
    9616           1 :     nsBoxLayoutMetrics* metrics = BoxMetrics();
    9617           1 :     if (!DoesNeedRecalc(metrics->mBlockPrefSize))
    9618           1 :       return NS_OK;
    9619             : 
    9620             :     // the rect we plan to size to.
    9621           1 :     nsRect rect = GetRect();

    9628             :       // wrapping inside of us should not apply font size inflation.
    9629           1 :       AutoMaybeDisableFontInflation an(this);
    9630             : 
    9631             :       metrics->mBlockPrefSize.width =
    9632           1 :         GetPrefISize(rendContext) + bp.LeftRight();
    9633             :       metrics->mBlockMinSize.width =
    9634           1 :         GetMinISize(rendContext) + bp.LeftRight();
    9635             :     }
    9636             : 
    9637             :     // do the nasty.
    9638           1 :     const WritingMode wm = aState.OuterReflowInput() ?
    9639           1 :       aState.OuterReflowInput()->GetWritingMode() : GetWritingMode();
    9640           1 :     ReflowOutput desiredSize(wm);
    9641             :     BoxReflow(aState, presContext, desiredSize, rendContext,
    9642             :               rect.x, rect.y,
    9643           1 :               metrics->mBlockPrefSize.width, NS_UNCONSTRAINEDSIZE);
    9644             : 
    9645           1 :     metrics->mBlockMinSize.height = 0;

    9647             :     // ask the block for its line iterator. Get the max ascent.
    9648           1 :     nsAutoLineIterator lines = GetLineIterator();
    9649           1 :     if (lines) 
    9650             :     {
    9651           1 :       metrics->mBlockMinSize.height = 0;
    9652           1 :       int count = 0;
    9653           1 :       nsIFrame* firstFrame = nullptr;
    9654             :       int32_t framesOnLine;

    9660           1 :          if (lineBounds.height > metrics->mBlockMinSize.height)
    9661           1 :            metrics->mBlockMinSize.height = lineBounds.height;
    9662             : 
    9663           1 :          count++;
    9664             :       } while(firstFrame);
    9665             :     } else {
    9666           1 :       metrics->mBlockMinSize.height = desiredSize.Height();
    9667             :     }
    9668             : 
    9669           1 :     metrics->mBlockPrefSize.height = metrics->mBlockMinSize.height;
    9670             : 
    9671           1 :     if (desiredSize.BlockStartAscent() ==
    9672             :         ReflowOutput::ASK_FOR_BASELINE) {
    9673           1 :       if (!nsLayoutUtils::GetFirstLineBaseline(wm, this,
    9674           1 :                                                &metrics->mBlockAscent))
    9675           1 :         metrics->mBlockAscent = GetLogicalBaseline(wm);
    9676             :     } else {
    9677           1 :       metrics->mBlockAscent = desiredSize.BlockStartAscent();
    9678           1 :     }
    9679             : 
    9680             : #ifdef DEBUG_adaptor
    9681             :     printf("min=(%d,%d), pref=(%d,%d), ascent=%d\n", metrics->mBlockMinSize.width,

    9683             :                                                      metrics->mBlockPrefSize.width,

    9821           1 : nsFrame::DoXULLayout(nsBoxLayoutState& aState)

    9902             : void
    9903           1 : nsFrame::BoxReflow(nsBoxLayoutState&        aState,
    9904             :                    nsPresContext*           aPresContext,
    9905             :                    ReflowOutput&     aDesiredSize,
    9906             :                    nsRenderingContext*     aRenderingContext,
    9907             :                    nscoord                  aX,
    9908             :                    nscoord                  aY,
    9909             :                    nscoord                  aWidth,
    9910             :                    nscoord                  aHeight,
    9911             :                    bool                     aMoveFrame)
    9912             : {
    9913             :   DO_GLOBAL_REFLOW_COUNT("nsBoxToBlockAdaptor");
    9914             : 
    9915             : #ifdef DEBUG_REFLOW
    9916             :   nsAdaptorAddIndents();
    9917             :   printf("Reflowing: ");
    9918             :   nsFrame::ListTag(stdout, mFrame);
    9919             :   printf("\n");
    9920             :   gIndent2++;
    9921             : #endif
    9922             : 
    9923           1 :   nsBoxLayoutMetrics *metrics = BoxMetrics();
    9924           1 :   nsReflowStatus status;
    9925           1 :   WritingMode wm = aDesiredSize.GetWritingMode();
    9926             : 
    9927           1 :   bool needsReflow = NS_SUBTREE_DIRTY(this);
    9928             : 
    9929             :   // if we don't need a reflow then 
    9930             :   // lets see if we are already that size. Yes? then don't even reflow. We are done.
    9931           1 :   if (!needsReflow) {
    9932             :       
    9933           1 :       if (aWidth != NS_INTRINSICSIZE && aHeight != NS_INTRINSICSIZE) {
    9934             :       
    9935             :           // if the new calculated size has a 0 width or a 0 height
    9936           0 :           if ((metrics->mLastSize.width == 0 || metrics->mLastSize.height == 0) && (aWidth == 0 || aHeight == 0)) {
    9937           0 :                needsReflow = false;
    9938           0 :                aDesiredSize.Width() = aWidth; 
    9939           0 :                aDesiredSize.Height() = aHeight; 
    9940           0 :                SetSize(aDesiredSize.Size(wm).ConvertTo(GetWritingMode(), wm));

    9942           0 :             aDesiredSize.Width() = metrics->mLastSize.width;

    9950           0 :                   needsReflow = true;
    9951             :    
    9952             :           }
    9953             :       } else {
    9954             :           // if the width or height are intrinsic alway reflow because
    9955             :           // we don't know what it should be.
    9956             :          needsReflow = true;
    9957             :       }
    9958             :   }
    9959             : 
    9960             :   // ok now reflow the child into the spacers calculated space
    9961           1 :   if (needsReflow) {
    9962             : 
    9963             :     aDesiredSize.ClearSize();

    9966             :

    9978           1 :     nsIFrame *parentFrame = GetParent();

    9982             :                         LogicalSize(parentWM, parentSize),
    9983           1 :                         ReflowInput::DUMMY_PARENT_REFLOW_STATE);

    9985             :     // This may not do very much useful, but it's probably worth trying.
    9986           1 :     if (parentSize.width != NS_INTRINSICSIZE)
    9987           1 :       parentReflowInput.SetComputedWidth(std::max(parentSize.width, 0));
    9988           1 :     if (parentSize.height != NS_INTRINSICSIZE)

    9995           1 :       parentReflowInput.ComputedPhysicalPadding();

    9997             :     // Construct the parent chain manually since constructing it normally
    9998             :     // messes up dimensions.
    9999           1 :     const ReflowInput *outerReflowInput = aState.OuterReflowInput();

   10002             :     const ReflowInput* parentRI;
   10003           1 :     if (outerReflowInput && outerReflowInput->mFrame == parentFrame) {

   10005             :       // box reflow and then straight out of it on the child frame.

   10015             :     // (It used to have a bogus parent, skipping all the boxes).
   10016           1 :     WritingMode wm = GetWritingMode();
   10017           1 :     LogicalSize logicalSize(wm, nsSize(aWidth, aHeight));
   10018           1 :     logicalSize.BSize(wm) = NS_INTRINSICSIZE;
   10019             :     ReflowInput reflowInput(aPresContext, *parentRI, this,
   10020             :                                   logicalSize, nullptr,
   10021           1 :                                   ReflowInput::DUMMY_PARENT_REFLOW_STATE);

   10023             :     // XXX_jwir3: This is somewhat fishy. If this is actually changing the value
   10024             :     //            here (which it might be), then we should make sure that it's
   10025             :     //            correct the first time around, rather than changing it later.
   10026           1 :     reflowInput.mCBReflowInput = parentRI;
   10027             : 
   10028           1 :     reflowInput.mReflowDepth = aState.GetReflowDepth();
   10029             : 
   10030             :     // mComputedWidth and mComputedHeight are content-box, not
   10031             :     // border-box
   10032           1 :     if (aWidth != NS_INTRINSICSIZE) {
   10033             :       nscoord computedWidth =
   10034           1 :         aWidth - reflowInput.ComputedPhysicalBorderPadding().LeftRight();
   10035           1 :       computedWidth = std::max(computedWidth, 0);
   10036           1 :       reflowInput.SetComputedWidth(computedWidth);
   10037             :     }
   10038             : 
   10039             :     // Most child frames of box frames (e.g. subdocument or scroll frames)
   10040             :     // need to be constrained to the provided size and overflow as necessary.
   10041             :     // The one exception are block frames, because we need to know their
   10042             :     // natural height excluding any overflow area which may be caused by
   10043             :     // various CSS effects such as shadow or outline.
   10044           1 :     if (!IsFrameOfType(eBlockFrame)) {
   10045           1 :       if (aHeight != NS_INTRINSICSIZE) {
   10046             :         nscoord computedHeight =
   10047           1 :           aHeight - reflowInput.ComputedPhysicalBorderPadding().TopBottom();
   10048           1 :         computedHeight = std::max(computedHeight, 0);
   10049           1 :         reflowInput.SetComputedHeight(computedHeight);
   10050             :       } else {
   10051             :         reflowInput.SetComputedHeight(
   10052             :           ComputeSize(aRenderingContext, wm,
   10053             :                       logicalSize,
   10054           1 :                       logicalSize.ISize(wm),
   10055           1 :                       reflowInput.ComputedLogicalMargin().Size(wm),
   10056           1 :                       reflowInput.ComputedLogicalBorderPadding().Size(wm) -
   10057           1 :                         reflowInput.ComputedLogicalPadding().Size(wm),
   10058           1 :                       reflowInput.ComputedLogicalPadding().Size(wm),
   10059           1 :                       ComputeSizeFlags::eDefault).Height(wm));
   10060             :       }
   10061             :     }
   10062             : 
   10063             :     // Box layout calls SetRect before XULLayout, whereas non-box layout
   10064             :     // calls SetRect after Reflow.
   10065             :     // XXX Perhaps we should be doing this by twiddling the rect back to
   10066             :     // mLastSize before calling Reflow and then switching it back, but
   10067             :     // However, mLastSize can also be the size passed to BoxReflow by
   10068             :     // RefreshSizeCache, so that doesn't really make sense.
   10069           1 :     if (metrics->mLastSize.width != aWidth) {

   10473             : nsAdaptorPrintReason(ReflowInput& aReflowInput)

   10478             :     {
   10479             :         case eReflowReason_Initial:
   10480             :           reflowReasonString = "initial";
   10481             :           break;
   10482             : 
   10483             :         case eReflowReason_Resize:
   10484             :           reflowReasonString = "resize";
   10485             :           break;
   10486             :         case eReflowReason_Dirty:
   10487             :           reflowReasonString = "dirty";
   10488             :           break;
   10489             :         case eReflowReason_StyleChange:
   10490             :           reflowReasonString = "stylechange";
   10491             :           break;
   10492             :         case eReflowReason_Incremental: 
   10493             :         {
   10494             :             switch (aReflowInput.reflowCommand->Type()) {
   10495             :               case eReflowType_StyleChanged:
   10496             :                  reflowReasonString = "incremental (StyleChanged)";
   10497             :               break;
   10498             :               case eReflowType_ReflowDirty:
   10499             :                  reflowReasonString = "incremental (ReflowDirty)";
   10500             :               break;
   10501             :               default:
   10502             :                  reflowReasonString = "incremental (Unknown)";
   10503             :             }
   10504             :         }                             
   10505             :         break;
   10506             :         default:
   10507             :           reflowReasonString = "unknown";
   10508             :           break;
   10509             :     }
   10510             : 
   10511             :     printf("%s",reflowReasonString);
   10512             : }

   10584             : }
   10585             : 
   10586             : // Start Display Reflow
   10587             : #ifdef DEBUG
   10588             :

   10764             : 
   10765             : static DR_State *DR_state; // the one and only DR_State
   10766             : 
   10767             : struct DR_RulePart 
   10768             : {
   10769             :   explicit DR_RulePart(nsIAtom* aFrameType) : mFrameType(aFrameType), mNext(0) {}
   10770             :   void Destroy();
   10771             : 
   10772             :   nsIAtom*     mFrameType;
   10773             :   DR_RulePart* mNext;
   10774             : };
   10775             : 
   10776             : void DR_RulePart::Destroy()
   10777             : {
   10778             :   if (mNext) {
   10779             :     mNext->Destroy();
   10780             :   }
   10781             :   delete this;
   10782             : }
   10783             : 
   10784             : struct DR_Rule 
   10785             : {
   10786             :   DR_Rule() : mLength(0), mTarget(nullptr), mDisplay(false) {
   10787             :     MOZ_COUNT_CTOR(DR_Rule);
   10788             :   }
   10789             :   ~DR_Rule() {
   10790             :     if (mTarget) mTarget->Destroy();
   10791             :     MOZ_COUNT_DTOR(DR_Rule);
   10792             :   }
   10793             :   void AddPart(nsIAtom* aFrameType);
   10794             : 
   10795             :   uint32_t      mLength;
   10796             :   DR_RulePart*  mTarget;
   10797             :   bool          mDisplay;
   10798             : };
   10799             : 
   10800             : void DR_Rule::AddPart(nsIAtom* aFrameType)
   10801             : {
   10802             :   DR_RulePart* newPart = new DR_RulePart(aFrameType);
   10803             :   newPart->mNext = mTarget;
   10804             :   mTarget = newPart;
   10805             :   mLength++;
   10806             : }
   10807             : 
   10808             : struct DR_FrameTypeInfo
   10809             : {
   10810             :   DR_FrameTypeInfo(nsIAtom* aFrmeType, const char* aFrameNameAbbrev, const char* aFrameName);
   10811             :   ~DR_FrameTypeInfo() { 
   10812             :       int32_t numElements;
   10813             :       numElements = mRules.Length();
   10814             :       for (int32_t i = numElements - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
   10815             :         delete mRules.ElementAt(i);
   10816             :       }
   10817             :    }
   10818             : 
   10819             :   nsIAtom*    mType;
   10820             :   char        mNameAbbrev[16];
   10821             :   char        mName[32];
   10822             :   nsTArray<DR_Rule*> mRules;
   10823             : private:
   10824             :   DR_FrameTypeInfo& operator=(const DR_FrameTypeInfo&) = delete;
   10825             : };

   10853             : 
   10854             : // DR_State implementation
   10855             : 
   10856             : DR_State::DR_State() 
   10857             : : mInited(false), mActive(false), mCount(0), mAssert(-1), mIndent(0), 
   10858             :   mIndentUndisplayedFrames(false), mDisplayPixelErrors(false)
   10859             : {
   10860             :   MOZ_COUNT_CTOR(DR_State);
   10861             : }
   10862             : 
   10863             : void DR_State::Init() 
   10864             : {
   10865             :   char* env = PR_GetEnv("GECKO_DISPLAY_REFLOW_ASSERT");
   10866             :   int32_t num;
   10867             :   if (env) {
   10868             :     if (GetNumber(env, num)) 
   10869             :       mAssert = num;
   10870             :     else 
   10871             :       printf("GECKO_DISPLAY_REFLOW_ASSERT - invalid value = %s", env);
   10872             :   }
   10873             : 
   10874             :   env = PR_GetEnv("GECKO_DISPLAY_REFLOW_INDENT_START");
   10875             :   if (env) {
   10876             :     if (GetNumber(env, num)) 
   10877             :       mIndent = num;
   10878             :     else 
   10879             :       printf("GECKO_DISPLAY_REFLOW_INDENT_START - invalid value = %s", env);
   10880             :   }
   10881             : 
   10882             :   env = PR_GetEnv("GECKO_DISPLAY_REFLOW_INDENT_UNDISPLAYED_FRAMES");
   10883             :   if (env) {
   10884             :     if (GetNumber(env, num)) 
   10885             :       mIndentUndisplayedFrames = num;
   10886             :     else 
   10887             :       printf("GECKO_DISPLAY_REFLOW_INDENT_UNDISPLAYED_FRAMES - invalid value = %s", env);
   10888             :   }
   10889             : 
   10890             :   env = PR_GetEnv("GECKO_DISPLAY_REFLOW_FLAG_PIXEL_ERRORS");
   10891             :   if (env) {
   10892             :     if (GetNumber(env, num)) 
   10893             :       mDisplayPixelErrors = num;
   10894             :     else 
   10895             :       printf("GECKO_DISPLAY_REFLOW_FLAG_PIXEL_ERRORS - invalid value = %s", env);
   10896             :   }
   10897             : 
   10898             :   InitFrameTypeTable();
   10899             :   ParseRulesFile();
   10900             :   mInited = true;
   10901             : }
   10902             : 
   10903             : DR_State::~DR_State()
   10904             : {
   10905             :   MOZ_COUNT_DTOR(DR_State);
   10906             :   int32_t numElements, i;
   10907             :   numElements = mWildRules.Length();
   10908             :   for (i = numElements - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
   10909             :     delete mWildRules.ElementAt(i);
   10910             :   }
   10911             :   numElements = mFrameTreeLeaves.Length();
   10912             :   for (i = numElements - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
   10913             :     delete mFrameTreeLeaves.ElementAt(i);
   10914             :   }
   10915             : }
   10916             : 
   10917             : bool DR_State::GetNumber(char*     aBuf, 
   10918             :                            int32_t&  aNumber)
   10919             : {
   10920             :   if (sscanf(aBuf, "%d", &aNumber) > 0) 
   10921             :     return true;
   10922             :   else 
   10923             :     return false;
   10924             : }
   10925             : 
   10926             : bool DR_State::IsWhiteSpace(int c) {
   10927             :   return (c == ' ') || (c == '\t') || (c == '\n') || (c == '\r');
   10928             : }
   10929             : 
   10930             : bool DR_State::GetToken(FILE* aFile,
   10931             :                           char* aBuf,
   10932             :                           size_t aBufSize)
   10933             : {
   10934             :   bool haveToken = false;
   10935             :   aBuf[0] = 0;
   10936             :   // get the 1st non whitespace char
   10937             :   int c = -1;
   10938             :   for (c = getc(aFile); (c > 0) && IsWhiteSpace(c); c = getc(aFile)) {
   10939             :   }
   10940             : 
   10941             :   if (c > 0) {
   10942             :     haveToken = true;
   10943             :     aBuf[0] = c;
   10944             :     // get everything up to the next whitespace char
   10945             :     size_t cX;
   10946             :     for (cX = 1; cX + 1 < aBufSize ; cX++) {
   10947             :       c = getc(aFile);
   10948             :       if (c < 0) { // EOF
   10949             :         ungetc(' ', aFile); 
   10950             :         break;
   10951             :       }
   10952             :       else {
   10953             :         if (IsWhiteSpace(c)) {
   10954             :           break;
   10955             :         }
   10956             :         else {
   10957             :           aBuf[cX] = c;
   10958             :         }
   10959             :       }
   10960             :     }
   10961             :     aBuf[cX] = 0;
   10962             :   }
   10963             :   return haveToken;
   10964             : }
   10965             : 
   10966             : DR_Rule* DR_State::ParseRule(FILE* aFile)
   10967             : {
   10968             :   char buf[128];
   10969             :   int32_t doDisplay;
   10970             :   DR_Rule* rule = nullptr;
   10971             :   while (GetToken(aFile, buf, sizeof(buf))) {
   10972             :     if (GetNumber(buf, doDisplay)) {
   10973             :       if (rule) { 
   10974             :         rule->mDisplay = !!doDisplay;
   10975             :         break;
   10976             :       }
   10977             :       else {
   10978             :         printf("unexpected token - %s \n", buf);
   10979             :       }
   10980             :     }
   10981             :     else {
   10982             :       if (!rule) {
   10983             :         rule = new DR_Rule;
   10984             :       }
   10985             :       if (strcmp(buf, "*") == 0) {
   10986             :         rule->AddPart(nullptr);
   10987             :       }
   10988             :       else {
   10989             :         DR_FrameTypeInfo* info = GetFrameTypeInfo(buf);
   10990             :         if (info) {
   10991             :           rule->AddPart(info->mType);
   10992             :         }
   10993             :         else {
   10994             :           printf("invalid frame type - %s \n", buf);
   10995             :         }
   10996             :       }
   10997             :     }
   10998             :   }
   10999             :   return rule;
   11000             : }
   11001             : 
   11002             : void DR_State::AddRule(nsTArray<DR_Rule*>& aRules,
   11003             :                        DR_Rule&            aRule)
   11004             : {
   11005             :   int32_t numRules = aRules.Length();
   11006             :   for (int32_t ruleX = 0; ruleX < numRules; ruleX++) {
   11007             :     DR_Rule* rule = aRules.ElementAt(ruleX);
   11008             :     NS_ASSERTION(rule, "program error");
   11009             :     if (aRule.mLength > rule->mLength) {
   11010             :       aRules.InsertElementAt(ruleX, &aRule);
   11011             :       return;
   11012             :     }
   11013             :   }
   11014             :   aRules.AppendElement(&aRule);
   11015             : }
   11016             : 
   11017             : void DR_State::ParseRulesFile()
   11018             : {
   11019             :   char* path = PR_GetEnv("GECKO_DISPLAY_REFLOW_RULES_FILE");
   11020             :   if (path) {
   11021             :     FILE* inFile = fopen(path, "r");
   11022             :     if (inFile) {
   11023             :       for (DR_Rule* rule = ParseRule(inFile); rule; rule = ParseRule(inFile)) {
   11024             :         if (rule->mTarget) {
   11025             :           nsIAtom* fType = rule->mTarget->mFrameType;
   11026             :           if (fType) {
   11027             :             DR_FrameTypeInfo* info = GetFrameTypeInfo(fType);
   11028             :             if (info) {
   11029             :               AddRule(info->mRules, *rule);
   11030             :             }
   11031             :           }
   11032             :           else {
   11033             :             AddRule(mWildRules, *rule);
   11034             :           }
   11035             :           mActive = true;
   11036             :         }
   11037             :       }
   11038             : 
   11039             :       fclose(inFile);
   11040             :     }
   11041             :   }
   11042             : }
   11043             : 
   11044             : 
   11045             : void DR_State::AddFrameTypeInfo(nsIAtom* aFrameType,
   11046             :                                 const char* aFrameNameAbbrev,
   11047             :                                 const char* aFrameName)
   11048             : {
   11049             :   mFrameTypeTable.AppendElement(DR_FrameTypeInfo(aFrameType, aFrameNameAbbrev, aFrameName));
   11050             : }
   11051             : 
   11052             : DR_FrameTypeInfo* DR_State::GetFrameTypeInfo(nsIAtom* aFrameType)
   11053             : {
   11054             :   int32_t numEntries = mFrameTypeTable.Length();
   11055             :   NS_ASSERTION(numEntries != 0, "empty FrameTypeTable");
   11056             :   for (int32_t i = 0; i < numEntries; i++) {
   11057             :     DR_FrameTypeInfo& info = mFrameTypeTable.ElementAt(i);
   11058             :     if (info.mType == aFrameType) {
   11059             :       return &info;
   11060             :     }
   11061             :   }
   11062             :   return &mFrameTypeTable.ElementAt(numEntries - 1); // return unknown frame type
   11063             : }
   11064             : 
   11065             : DR_FrameTypeInfo* DR_State::GetFrameTypeInfo(char* aFrameName)
   11066             : {
   11067             :   int32_t numEntries = mFrameTypeTable.Length();
   11068             :   NS_ASSERTION(numEntries != 0, "empty FrameTypeTable");
   11069             :   for (int32_t i = 0; i < numEntries; i++) {
   11070             :     DR_FrameTypeInfo& info = mFrameTypeTable.ElementAt(i);
   11071             :     if ((strcmp(aFrameName, info.mName) == 0) || (strcmp(aFrameName, info.mNameAbbrev) == 0)) {
   11072             :       return &info;
   11073             :     }
   11074             :   }
   11075             :   return &mFrameTypeTable.ElementAt(numEntries - 1); // return unknown frame type
   11076             : }
   11077             : 
   11078             : void DR_State::InitFrameTypeTable()
   11079             : {  
   11080             :   AddFrameTypeInfo(nsGkAtoms::blockFrame,            "block",     "block");
   11081             :   AddFrameTypeInfo(nsGkAtoms::brFrame,               "br",        "br");
   11082             :   AddFrameTypeInfo(nsGkAtoms::bulletFrame,           "bullet",    "bullet");
   11083             :   AddFrameTypeInfo(nsGkAtoms::colorControlFrame,     "color",     "colorControl");
   11084             :   AddFrameTypeInfo(nsGkAtoms::gfxButtonControlFrame, "button",    "gfxButtonControl");
   11085             :   AddFrameTypeInfo(nsGkAtoms::HTMLButtonControlFrame, "HTMLbutton",    "HTMLButtonControl");
   11086             :   AddFrameTypeInfo(nsGkAtoms::HTMLCanvasFrame,       "HTMLCanvas","HTMLCanvas");
   11087             :   AddFrameTypeInfo(nsGkAtoms::subDocumentFrame,      "subdoc",    "subDocument");
   11088             :   AddFrameTypeInfo(nsGkAtoms::imageFrame,            "img",       "image");
   11089             :   AddFrameTypeInfo(nsGkAtoms::inlineFrame,           "inline",    "inline");
   11090             :   AddFrameTypeInfo(nsGkAtoms::letterFrame,           "letter",    "letter");
   11091             :   AddFrameTypeInfo(nsGkAtoms::lineFrame,             "line",      "line");
   11092             :   AddFrameTypeInfo(nsGkAtoms::listControlFrame,      "select",    "select");
   11093             :   AddFrameTypeInfo(nsGkAtoms::objectFrame,           "obj",       "object");
   11094             :   AddFrameTypeInfo(nsGkAtoms::pageFrame,             "page",      "page");
   11095             :   AddFrameTypeInfo(nsGkAtoms::placeholderFrame,      "place",     "placeholder");

   11120             : void DR_State::DisplayFrameTypeInfo(nsIFrame* aFrame,
   11121             :                                     int32_t   aIndent)
   11122             : {

   11136             :       }

   11143             : 
   11144             : bool DR_State::RuleMatches(DR_Rule&          aRule,
   11145             :                              DR_FrameTreeNode& aNode)
   11146             : {
   11147             :   NS_ASSERTION(aRule.mTarget, "program error");
   11148             : 
   11149             :   DR_RulePart* rulePart;
   11150             :   DR_FrameTreeNode* parentNode;
   11151             :   for (rulePart = aRule.mTarget->mNext, parentNode = aNode.mParent;
   11152             :        rulePart && parentNode;
   11153             :        rulePart = rulePart->mNext, parentNode = parentNode->mParent) {
   11154             :     if (rulePart->mFrameType) {
   11155             :       if (parentNode->mFrame) {
   11156             :         if (rulePart->mFrameType != parentNode->mFrame->GetType()) {
   11157             :           return false;
   11158             :         }
   11159             :       }
   11160             :       else NS_ASSERTION(false, "program error");
   11161             :     }
   11162             :     // else wild card match
   11163             :   }
   11164             :   return true;
   11165             : }
   11166             : 
   11167             : void DR_State::FindMatchingRule(DR_FrameTreeNode& aNode)
   11168             : {
   11169             :   if (!aNode.mFrame) {
   11170             :     NS_ASSERTION(false, "invalid DR_FrameTreeNode \n");
   11171             :     return;
   11172             :   }
   11173             : 
   11174             :   bool matchingRule = false;
   11175             : 
   11176             :   DR_FrameTypeInfo* info = GetFrameTypeInfo(aNode.mFrame->GetType());
   11177             :   NS_ASSERTION(info, "program error");
   11178             :   int32_t numRules = info->mRules.Length();
   11179             :   for (int32_t ruleX = 0; ruleX < numRules; ruleX++) {
   11180             :     DR_Rule* rule = info->mRules.ElementAt(ruleX);
   11181             :     if (rule && RuleMatches(*rule, aNode)) {
   11182             :       aNode.mDisplay = rule->mDisplay;
   11183             :       matchingRule = true;
   11184             :       break;
   11185             :     }
   11186             :   }
   11187             :   if (!matchingRule) {
   11188             :     int32_t numWildRules = mWildRules.Length();
   11189             :     for (int32_t ruleX = 0; ruleX < numWildRules; ruleX++) {
   11190             :       DR_Rule* rule = mWildRules.ElementAt(ruleX);
   11191             :       if (rule && RuleMatches(*rule, aNode)) {
   11192             :         aNode.mDisplay = rule->mDisplay;
   11193             :         break;
   11194             :       }
   11195             :     }
   11196             :   }
   11197             : }
   11198             :     
   11199             : DR_FrameTreeNode* DR_State::CreateTreeNode(nsIFrame*                aFrame,
   11200             :                                            const ReflowInput* aReflowInput)
   11201             : {
   11202             :   // find the frame of the parent reflow state (usually just the parent of aFrame)
   11203             :   nsIFrame* parentFrame;
   11204             :   if (aReflowInput) {
   11205             :     const ReflowInput* parentRI = aReflowInput->mParentReflowInput;
   11206             :     parentFrame = (parentRI) ? parentRI->mFrame : nullptr;
   11207             :   } else {
   11208             :     parentFrame = aFrame->GetParent();
   11209             :   }
   11210             : 
   11211             :   // find the parent tree node leaf
   11212             :   DR_FrameTreeNode* parentNode = nullptr;
   11213             :   
   11214             :   DR_FrameTreeNode* lastLeaf = nullptr;
   11215             :   if(mFrameTreeLeaves.Length())
   11216             :     lastLeaf = mFrameTreeLeaves.ElementAt(mFrameTreeLeaves.Length() - 1);
   11217             :   if (lastLeaf) {
   11218             :     for (parentNode = lastLeaf; parentNode && (parentNode->mFrame != parentFrame); parentNode = parentNode->mParent) {
   11219             :     }
   11220             :   }
   11221             :   DR_FrameTreeNode* newNode = new DR_FrameTreeNode(aFrame, parentNode);
   11222             :   FindMatchingRule(*newNode);
   11223             : 
   11224             :   newNode->mIndent = mIndent;
   11225             :   if (newNode->mDisplay || mIndentUndisplayedFrames) {
   11226             :     ++mIndent;
   11227             :   }
   11228             : 
   11229             :   if (lastLeaf && (lastLeaf == parentNode)) {
   11230             :     mFrameTreeLeaves.RemoveElementAt(mFrameTreeLeaves.Length() - 1);
   11231             :   }
   11232             :   mFrameTreeLeaves.AppendElement(newNode);
   11233             :   mCount++;
   11234             : 
   11235             :   return newNode;
   11236             : }
   11237             : 
   11238             : void DR_State::PrettyUC(nscoord aSize,
   11239             :                         char*   aBuf,
   11240             :                         int     aBufSize)
   11241             : {
   11242             :   if (NS_UNCONSTRAINEDSIZE == aSize) {
   11243             :     strcpy(aBuf, "UC");
   11244             :   }
   11245             :   else {
   11246             :     if ((nscoord)0xdeadbeefU == aSize)
   11247             :     {
   11248             :       strcpy(aBuf, "deadbeef");
   11249             :     }
   11250             :     else {
   11251             :       snprintf(aBuf, aBufSize, "%d", aSize);
   11252             :     }
   11253             :   }
   11254             : }
   11255             : 
   11256             : void DR_State::PrintMargin(const char *tag, const nsMargin* aMargin)
   11257             : {
   11258             :   if (aMargin) {
   11259             :     char t[16], r[16], b[16], l[16];
   11260             :     PrettyUC(aMargin->top, t, 16);
   11261             :     PrettyUC(aMargin->right, r, 16);
   11262             :     PrettyUC(aMargin->bottom, b, 16);
   11263             :     PrettyUC(aMargin->left, l, 16);
   11264             :     printf(" %s=%s,%s,%s,%s", tag, t, r, b, l);
   11265             :   } else {
   11266             :     // use %p here for consistency with other null-pointer printouts
   11267             :     printf(" %s=%p", tag, (void*)aMargin);
   11268             :   }
   11269             : }
   11270             : 
   11271             : void DR_State::DeleteTreeNode(DR_FrameTreeNode& aNode)
   11272             : {
   11273             :   mFrameTreeLeaves.RemoveElement(&aNode);
   11274             :   int32_t numLeaves = mFrameTreeLeaves.Length();
   11275             :   if ((0 == numLeaves) || (aNode.mParent != mFrameTreeLeaves.ElementAt(numLeaves - 1))) {
   11276             :     mFrameTreeLeaves.AppendElement(aNode.mParent);
   11277             :   }
   11278             : 
   11279             :   if (aNode.mDisplay || mIndentUndisplayedFrames) {
   11280             :     --mIndent;
   11281             :   }
   11282             :   // delete the tree node 
   11283             :   delete &aNode;
   11284             : }
   11285             : 
   11286             : static void
   11287             : CheckPixelError(nscoord aSize,
   11288             :                 int32_t aPixelToTwips)
   11289             : {
   11290             :   if (NS_UNCONSTRAINEDSIZE != aSize) {
   11291             :     if ((aSize % aPixelToTwips) > 0) {
   11292             :       printf("VALUE %d is not a whole pixel \n", aSize);
   11293             :     }
   11294             :   }

   11297             : static void DisplayReflowEnterPrint(nsPresContext*          aPresContext,
   11298             :                                     nsIFrame*                aFrame,
   11299             :                                     const ReflowInput& aReflowInput,
   11300             :                                     DR_FrameTreeNode&        aTreeNode,
   11301             :                                     bool                     aChanged)
   11302             : {
   11303             :   if (aTreeNode.mDisplay) {
   11304             :     DR_state->DisplayFrameTypeInfo(aFrame, aTreeNode.mIndent);
   11305             : 
   11306             :     char width[16];
   11307             :     char height[16];
   11308             : 
   11309             :     DR_state->PrettyUC(aReflowInput.AvailableWidth(), width, 16);
   11310             :     DR_state->PrettyUC(aReflowInput.AvailableHeight(), height, 16);
   11311             :     printf("Reflow a=%s,%s ", width, height);
   11312             : 
   11313             :     DR_state->PrettyUC(aReflowInput.ComputedWidth(), width, 16);
   11314             :     DR_state->PrettyUC(aReflowInput.ComputedHeight(), height, 16);

   11316             :

   11318             :       printf("dirty ");
   11319             :

   11321             :       printf("dirty-children ");
   11322             :

   11324             :       printf("special-bsize ");
   11325             : 
   11326             :     if (aReflowInput.IsHResize())
   11327             :       printf("h-resize ");
   11328             : 
   11329             :     if (aReflowInput.IsVResize())
   11330             :       printf("v-resize ");
   11331             : 
   11332             :     nsIFrame* inFlow = aFrame->GetPrevInFlow();
   11333             :     if (inFlow) {
   11334             :       printf("pif=%p ", (void*)inFlow);
   11335             :     }
   11336             :     inFlow = aFrame->GetNextInFlow();
   11337             :     if (inFlow) {
   11338             :       printf("nif=%p ", (void*)inFlow);
   11339             :     }

   11341             :       printf("CHANGED \n");
   11342             :     else 
   11343             :       printf("cnt=%d \n", DR_state->mCount);

   11345             :       int32_t p2t = aPresContext->AppUnitsPerDevPixel();

   11347             :       CheckPixelError(aReflowInput.AvailableHeight(), p2t);

   11350             :     }
   11351             :   }
   11352             : }

   11417             : void nsFrame::DisplayReflowExit(nsPresContext* aPresContext,
   11418             :                                 nsIFrame* aFrame,

   11421             :                                 void* aFrameTreeNode)

   11444             :       DR_state->PrettyUC(aMetrics.VisualOverflow().x, x, 16);

   11561             : /* static */ void*
   11562             : ReflowInput::DisplayInitConstraintsEnter(nsIFrame* aFrame,
   11563             :                                                ReflowInput* aState,
   11564             :                                                nscoord aContainingBlockWidth,
   11565             :                                                nscoord aContainingBlockHeight,
   11566             :                                                const nsMargin* aBorder,
   11567             :                                                const nsMargin* aPadding)
   11568             : {
   11569             :   NS_PRECONDITION(aFrame, "non-null frame required");
   11570             :   NS_PRECONDITION(aState, "non-null state required");
   11571             : 
   11572             :   if (!DR_state->mInited) DR_state->Init();
   11573             :   if (!DR_state->mActive) return nullptr;
   11574             : 
   11575             :   DR_FrameTreeNode* treeNode = DR_state->CreateTreeNode(aFrame, aState);
   11576             :   if (treeNode && treeNode->mDisplay) {
   11577             :     DR_state->DisplayFrameTypeInfo(aFrame, treeNode->mIndent);
   11578             : 
   11579             :     printf("InitConstraints parent=%p",
   11580             :            (void*)aState->mParentReflowInput);
   11581             : 
   11582             :     char width[16];
   11583             :     char height[16];

   11586             :     DR_state->PrettyUC(aContainingBlockHeight, height, 16);

   11596             :   }
   11597             :   return treeNode;
   11598             : }

   11601             : ReflowInput::DisplayInitConstraintsExit(nsIFrame* aFrame,

   11603             :                                               void* aValue)

   11699             : /* static */ void
   11700             : ReflowInput::DisplayInitFrameTypeExit(nsIFrame* aFrame,
   11701             :                                             ReflowInput* aState,
   11702             :                                             void* aValue)
   11703             : {
   11704             :   NS_PRECONDITION(aFrame, "non-null frame required");
   11705             :   NS_PRECONDITION(aState, "non-null state required");
   11706             : 
   11707             :   if (!DR_state->mActive) return;
   11708             :   if (!aValue) return;
   11709             : 
   11710             :   DR_FrameTreeNode* treeNode = (DR_FrameTreeNode*)aValue;
   11711             :   if (treeNode->mDisplay) {
   11712             :     DR_state->DisplayFrameTypeInfo(aFrame, treeNode->mIndent);
   11713             :     printf("InitFrameType");
   11714             : 
   11715             :     const nsStyleDisplay *disp = aState->mStyleDisplay;
   11716             : 
   11717             :     if (aFrame->GetStateBits() & NS_FRAME_OUT_OF_FLOW)
   11718             :       printf(" out-of-flow");
   11719             :     if (aFrame->GetPrevInFlow())
   11720             :       printf(" prev-in-flow");
   11721             :     if (aFrame->IsAbsolutelyPositioned())
   11722             :       printf(" abspos");
   11723             :     if (aFrame->IsFloating())
   11724             :       printf(" float");
   11725             : 
   11726             :     // This array must exactly match the StyleDisplay enum.
   11727             :     const char *const displayTypes[] = {
   11728             :       "none", "block", "inline", "inline-block", "list-item", "table",
   11729             :       "inline-table", "table-row-group", "table-column", "table-column",
   11730             :       "table-column-group", "table-header-group", "table-footer-group",
   11731             :       "table-row", "table-cell", "table-caption", "flex", "inline-flex",
   11732             :       "grid", "inline-grid", "ruby", "ruby-base", "ruby-base-container",
   11733             :       "ruby-text", "ruby-text-container", "contents", "-webkit-box",
   11734             :       "-webkit-inline-box", "box", "inline-box",
   11735             : #ifdef MOZ_XUL
   11736             :       "grid", "inline-grid", "grid-group", "grid-line", "stack",
   11737             :       "inline-stack", "deck", "groupbox", "popup",
   11738             : #endif
   11739             :     };
   11740             :     const uint32_t display = static_cast<uint32_t>(disp->mDisplay);
   11741             :     if (display >= ArrayLength(displayTypes))
   11742             :       printf(" display=%u", display);
   11743             :     else
   11744             :       printf(" display=%s", displayTypes[display]);
   11745             : 
   11746             :     // This array must exactly match the NS_CSS_FRAME_TYPE constants.
   11747             :     const char *const cssFrameTypes[] = {
   11748             :       "unknown", "inline", "block", "floating", "absolute", "internal-table"
   11749             :     };
   11750             :     nsCSSFrameType bareType = NS_FRAME_GET_TYPE(aState->mFrameType);
   11751             :     bool repNoBlock = NS_FRAME_IS_REPLACED_NOBLOCK(aState->mFrameType);
   11752             :     bool repBlock = NS_FRAME_IS_REPLACED_CONTAINS_BLOCK(aState->mFrameType);
   11753             : 
   11754             :     if (bareType >= ArrayLength(cssFrameTypes)) {
   11755             :       printf(" result=type %u", bareType);
   11756             :     } else {
   11757             :       printf(" result=%s", cssFrameTypes[bareType]);
   11758             :     }
   11759             :     printf("%s%s\n", repNoBlock ? " +rep" : "", repBlock ? " +repBlk" : "");
   11760             :   }
   11761             :   DR_state->DeleteTreeNode(*treeNode);
   11762             : }
